text: Na miejscu, w browarze. Bardzo przyjemny lambik, w aromacie dominują końskie nuty, w smaku dochodzi wyraźna beczka. Kolor ciemnożółty, prawie pomarańczowy, piana trwała, drobno pęcherzykowa. Złożone świetne piwo.
Bottle at the brewery. Hazy yellow colour small white head. Nose is fresh hoppy with a yeasty twist. Taste is low bitterness low-medium sourness. Fast finish. Very wine-like.
Aus der Flasche (bottled 2017-01-09) im Muted Horn Berlin 2017-03 getrunken. Eine ganz klassische Gueuze. Lecker!
Draught. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet and sour with notes of spices. Taste is sour and tart.

Tap. Tasted on the 11/05/2017 at Himmeriget (Copenhagen). Hazy golden to slightly orange colour with a low white head. Aroma of apples, peach, brett, vinegar and mild tart. Taste is medium tarty and fruity with a brett finish. Next one please!
W aromacie stajnia, owoce pestkowe. Super wytrawne, fest kwaśne, orzeźwiające. Świetne
Hazy golden liquid, average head. Aroma of oak and apple. Light body, strong carbonation. Taste is sour.

A: Light straw with no head
N: Lactic, gooseberries
T: Great funky mix upfront, fruity, followed by a good bitter grip on the tongue
P: Thin
O: Great lambic

Flaska från Beergium. 2015 vintage. Äppeljuicefärgad, disig, med en krämig skumpuck. En gräddig gueze med mjuk rund syra med mycket citrus, en lätt blommighet, mycket fat och en lätt beska som skvallrar om lite mer humle. Mycket gott.

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Hazy range with white head. The aroma has notes of sweet fruit cake, candy, sugar, pear, wood and yeasts. Sweet and sourish flavor with notes of fruits (pear), wood, lemon and herbs. Dry, flat, medium-bodied.
Bottle at the brewery. Hazy yellow. Aroma is floral and fruity, notes of barnyard and oak. Sweet-sour, citrus, oak, berries, oak, herbal. Light-bodied, dry. Interesting.

Somewhere: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is funky basements and that fun stuff... cheese and whatever. Taste is sour and biting. Complex and pretty deep while at the same time being easy to drink.

Mocno kwaśno/gorzkie. W aromacie solidna derka. Dużo tu skórzanego paska, jest mocno taniczne, ale przy tym o dziwo dosyć waniliowo słodkie. Składowe bardzo przyjemne ale całościowo jest to trochę dziwny lambic.
Draft in Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Small head, hazy golden in appearance. Initial tart hit with soft finish followed by lingering grapefruit notes. Smoothness increases by consumption.
Bottle - sublime - explosive flavour - such complexity - champagne masquerading as beer!

Rami Rami is drinking a Cuvée Saint-Gilloise (Champions) (2017) by Brasserie Cantillon at Saska Kępa

W cholere dziwne. Jest gorzkie a nie goryczkowe, jest oborzasto-skorzano-ciut-apteczne, jest minerane... ufo, nie moje, acz dobre wciaz

Bottle, vintages 2014 and 2016, at the brewery. Pours slightly cloudy yellow with a fine head. 2014: aroma of grassy and flowery hops, dank, but still funky. 2016: A damp wet cellar in the nose. Body and palate are very similar in both tart sour and fizzy, light and funky citric. Very good for 2014, nose is a bit off putting for 2016.

Pours an almost clear golden strawish yellow with a small white head. The nose offers up bretty yeast notes, dry and funky. Sweeter malt, grass and old hayish hops. Mouthfeel is alive in this 2+yo bottle but softens after 10 minutes, pleasant sour and mouthwatering finish, dry and mineral aftertaste. Very solid.

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, sour, onion
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam
Taste-light sweetness, medium sour
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish
Overall-very good

Imbottigliata il 9 gennaio 2017, aperta il 2 aprile dello stesso anno.
Schiuma bianca a grana media poco persistente e avara, color oro antico tendente allarancio lievemente opalescente.
Aroma di cuoio, frumento, leggero acetone, buccia duva, leggera mela verde, note di cantina e di botte.
In bocca attacca acidula con uva acerba, cuoio, botte, poi in successione mela verde, cantina e frumento che si prolungano in una coda amaricante erbacea e legnosa con leggerissime note di uva bianca molto prolungata che risulta leggermente astringente.
Retrolfatto di mela verde, frumento e cantina.
Corpo poco piÃ¹ che leggero, mediamente carbonata ed estremamente beverina.

Ziołowe, funkowe, kwaskowate - cytryna, ocet winny. Poza tym mokra skóra, lekka zagroda. Umiarkowanie kwaskowate, bardzo wytrawne, ściągające. Kwaśność raczej w stronę cytryny. Nawet nieźle złożone. CIało umiarkowane, tekstura oleista, kremowe. Ma swój niepowtarzalny cantillonowy styl, który lubię.

Zapach intensywny, stajnia, drewno, ziemia, cytrusy, trawa, zioła. Kolor złoty, mętne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku wytrawne, średnia pełnia, średnia kwaśność, cytrusy, drewno, stajnia, zioła, przyprawy, trawa. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.
gedeeld met lion in Wapse, amber met een bescheiden schuimkraag. Heerlijk aardbei mooi ziltig met ook appel en zuurkool nice one
Bottle in Cafe Rose Red in Bruges. Golden with a frothy white head. Funky sour aroma. Hint of lemon citrus, hay and white wine vinegar. The taste is rich with tart lemon juice, hay amd funk. Good.
Bottle in cafe rose red in Brugge. Pours golden and hazy with a nice white head. Nose is very sour bret. Very tart and a bit sharp. Grapefruit and lemon juice.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
On tap at Cantillon. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of sour apples, bret . Taste is sour, bret.

Pours cloudy apricot with low white head 
Aromas of cracked garden branch, garden leaves, over ripe fruits, earth 
Taste has tart notes of cracked garden branch, garden leaves, slightly herbal, citrus, earth 
Mouthfeel is tart, medium bodied, low to medium carbonated, low bitterness
Lemony cheesy socks nose, tart, bitter and complex, with earthy, faintly metallic bitterness, lemon tartness, a hint of onion skin, fascinating!

Une grande gueuze à la robe ambrée, une fine mousse, un nez qui allie des notes de lambic, de bois, de cerise acidulée et un coté balsamique et une bouche dune longueur kilométrique. Un monument à la hauteur de ce que lon attende de Cantillon.
Draught @ Akkurat, Stockholm Sweden. Hazy golden body with a low white head. Citrus, barnyard, fruit, herbal. Nice one.

Cantillon tasting at the Sovereign. 2015 vintage into a wineglass showing well filtered dark honey with no head. 

The nose shows notes of light vanilla and light notes of tart apricot. In general, clean and subtle but well put together here. 

The palate is no carbonated and medium bodied. Lightly tart with flavors of light apricot and no bitterness. Nice and simple, not bad.
Zwanze day 2016. Mild gold, constant small white head, fruity nose. Full body, slight tartness.

Keg @ Akkurat. Hazy golden, small firm white head, weak lacing. Funky barnyard aroma with a lot of oak barrels, grass, cheese, black pepper and mild tart white wine vinegar notes. Smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated, medium bodied. Mature cheese, woody and oaky taste, mushrooms, barnyard, mild citrus and vinegar tart, some sweet apricots and citrus lurking around in the background. Lovely!

01/10/2016 @home - 75cl bottle from the Brewery.
Hazy orange colour with small white head. Nose is sour, fruity, apricot, grapefruit. Taste is first citrus, some apricot, light touch of sweetnesd, sour, bit sulphur, bitterness. Realy complex.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy straw with a one finger head. Aroma of lacto-sour, straw, grass, funk, herbs. Taste is very herbal, medium to high acidic tart, lots of grass. Light to medium body, lots of flavor, very tasty.

375 mL bottle. Bottled 1/29/2010. Unknown original review date.

Barely a pop. Small white head atop a mostly clear body.

Nose is herbal. Funky. Less acidic than a Cantillon usually is. More in the 3F vein. White pepper in the back.

Taste is back to the true Cantillon sourness. Strong white wine notes and it gets herbal again after the sourness fades. The finish is far less acidic.

 Medium bodied. Strong wine presence that takes away from its spritz.

Excellent. My unedited review said "uncomplex," but I think I had no idea what I was talking about when I wrote that.
13-08-15 // sample at the brewery. Love the dry hopped lambic. Sour bitter well balanced. Fruity notes. Lambic tartness.

75cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 24-08-2016.
Bottled: January 2015.
In short: tasty not so dry gueuze.
Pouts hazy orange with frothy off white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Barnyard, citrusy, grassy nose. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is little dry, citrusy, some wood notes. Some dry aftertaste. Good.

Clear orange color with foam ring. Light funky nose with some old feet odors. Sour taste with light cheese and some funk and a light creamy mouth feeling. Sour bite in the finish with a light sweet character and a sour aftertaste.
Giallo torbido senza schiuma. Aroma intenso e deciso, acidulo, mela, uva. Palato più piacevole, acidità contenuta. Ottima.

750ml bottle from Firefly. Bottled March 9, 2015. Tasting at Brians. Pours a hazy golden with no head. Almost no carbonation. Aroma is very fruity and hoppy. Sour taste with the same notes. Good one.
Poured from bottle at Cantillon brewery in Brussels. Damn thing didnt even have a label on it yet. Ridiculously delicious. Classic lambic tartness but with a slightly bitter punch. Drink it.
Flaska rose red cafe, brygge. Grumlig orange vätska. Doft av stall, citron och äpplekart. Mycket syrlig smak med vinäger, stall, citron och jordkällare. Härligt "lantlig" geuze.

Köpt på Rose Red i Brugge. Lätt disig, gyllengul med liten vit skumkrona. Syrlig doft av vitvinsvinäger som sticker i näsan. Syrlig och lite besk kropp. Smak av vitvinsvinäger, grapefrukt- skal och äppelkart.
Bottle (2 years). Hazy orange with lacing white medium head. Aroma of leather, barnyard, grape, wood. Sweet and acidic flavour of wood, citrus, brett

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 Had a Gueuze and a Pale Ale before this, so it might influence the taste. Better than the Gueuze before, with a developed sour taste with hints of citrus and light bitter funk. Sour after taste. Good carbonification making for a pop when opening the cork which had lateral permiating bubles. Makes wonder what it tastes like aged some more. Bottled: 4.1.16. Lot: MAMF Temp: 5C. 750ml. Bought at brewery.

From notes. Enjoyed this one at the Brew Crew Bash in Ann Arbor on May 21. This one was poured from a 750 mL bottle. The pour is a foggy golden straw color with a thinner off white head that falls down to a collar, leaving no lace. The aroma is pretty harsh. There is a lot of dusty barnyard right up front. The hay, tart fruit skins, and a sharp earthiness really add to a decent complexity. It doesnt mean that its the best thing, but its complex, thats for sure. The flavor is a little sharper. There is a strong vinegary presence, and Im not feeling that at all. The dusty barnyard hangs out and there is a little lemongrass to it as well. There is a light souring to it, but it really is harsh and acidic. The mouth feel is light bodied for sure, with a bright carbonation that is almost a little too much. The aftertaste is lingeringly funky and carries a light tartness to go with the dustiness. Glad I got to try another Cantillon, but I think I would pass on this one in the future.
A bit hazy yellow beer with smallish head on top. Aroma has zesty citrus, sour green apples, funky notes too. Taste is sour, green apples, zesty lemon, some yeast. Medium body and high carbonation.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Strong sour aroma. Some sweet fruits. Mostly sour. Medium to high carbonation. Wild. Helt okej basic lambic. Falls a bit on the sour side.
Bottle at BGBB3 bottle share, sample. Tart and quite bitter, funk, lemon, wood, hay, dust. A bit harsh.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 75cl bottle at home, bottled 5 January 2015. Slightly cloudy golden, minimal foamy head that leaves a nice lacing. White grapes, vinegar, earthy, distant hop notes, light caramel malty base, woody vanilla. Medium sour and tard, dry finish. Good body, low carbonation.
Share bottle. Pours a hazy golden witha white top. Citric aroma with dried hay, stables and apples. Taste is sour and dry. Notes of apples, vinegar and dried hay. Good stuff.

Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 16/04/2016
Color amarillo, sabor afrutado, amargo, acidez moderada. buena

Aromas ácido de las cervezas de cantillon
Buen aspecto y carbónatacion correcta
Bien balanceada con un toque final ácido agradable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale yellow colour. Very nice high white head which goes smaller but stays quite long time. Refreshing aroma. Vinegar, white wine, hints of horseblanket and lemon. Vinegar, grass at first. Wood, hints of hops in the middle. Sour, citrussy finish. Bit cracky and funky. Vinegar in aftertaste. Rather light bodied, really refreshing, medium carbonated, amazing beer.
Pours fairly clear gold. Sweaty socks, lemon, vinegar. Hops cut acidity, slightly dull / not too dry. Fruits, brett, dank funk. Good.
A lambic matured for 2 years in oak. Strong but nice acidity. Very nice lambic with high potential..

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought from Malting Pot in Brussels. Superb sour cantillon geuze.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Feb 2016 - 750ml cork and cap bottle, as Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise 5%, bottled Nov 2012. Vibrant dark orange, opaque, foamy off-white head, nice lacing. Looks perfect. Aroma is lime, sweet sherbet, a little flowery, wet wood, dirty socks, background dried blood. Body is smooth, tingly carbonation. Taste is lime sherbet, homemade lemonade, nectarine, fruit salad, acidic cider. A very interesting, tasty beer. Classy stuff. (4.0)
Oct 2016 - Had three thirds of this from keg at Zwanze 2016, The Kernel.  A lovely rich, funky, dry beer - would happily have kept coming back to it if I wasnt so inebriated. (4.1)

Bottle at the brewery. Hazy gold. Minimal head. Nose has sweet fruit. Soft herb. Lightly cheesy funk. The herbal element is to the fore. Taste has a fruity sweetness. Tart and funky. Crisp palate. More of that, with some bitterness on the finish. Lovely.
Leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich fruchtig, holzig, helle Früchte. Geschmack trocken fruchtig, säuerlich, helle Früchte, Essig, Gewürze.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a thin mostly fading bubbly off white head. Aroma is floral, perfumy, dried fruits, apricot, melon. Taste is of melon, light hint of caramel, oranges, citrus, grassy, acidic, finish is flowery. Medium carbonation, soft oily mouthfeel.

duft: lidt syrligt duft. eddike. lidt grøn duft.
smag: citrus lime malt syrlig lidt eddike. æble

Bottle, 0.75l, courtesy of Bongtribe, shared with Boyan. Pours hazy orange golden color with thin totally diminishing off-white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma is citric, peachy, vinous, funky and cheesy. Taste starts sour grainy, follows tart fruity, vinous and funky, mouth feel is crisp and dry, while finish is mild bitter. Light body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. Refreshing and brilliant...

Bottle at home on Boxing Day. Phenomenal lambic. Great balance between the competing elements of brett funk and sourness, and with an intoxicating taste of grapes and tart apples, biscuits, and oak. If you can find it, drink it.

Draught. Pours slightly hazy, yellow with no head. Aroma is sour, tart fruits, apples, citrus, barnyard. In taste the beer is sour, citrusy with tart finish. Light body, high carbonation, dry in finish. Very good lambic.
Bottle @ Cantillon 15/5-15. [ As Cuvée Saint-Gilloise ]. Fruity with hoppy notes and citrus, also brett and green apples. Dry finish.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Hazy, golden color with minimal head. A little bit of citrus and hops and very balanced on the palate. Lots going on here to love.

0.75 bottle, bottled 17 February 2014. Pours yellow, a bit hazy, with white, creamy, stable head. Aromas of grapes, white fruits, lots of Brattanomyces notes. Taste is moderately sour, fruity, a bit tannic, astringent. Great beer.

Hazy orange color with white head that doesnt last. Complex funky-sour aroma with apples and pears, peaches, also something woody. Taste is wonderfully layered and strongly acidic. Best lambic Ive ever had.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Quintessence 2016. Hazy golden, full yellow, white head. Dry hopped. Hoppy nose and fruity hops up front, exotic fruits, hay, straw, grapes, apricot stone, grassiness, light doughy. Sweet base with light sour and under medium bitterness. Under medium body, minerallike texture. Light fizz, fruity hoppy finish. Very nice.

Pours in a cloudy amber color with a thin line of white head. Aroma; Apple, pear, apricot, grapes, lemon and funk. Flavours; sour green apples, pear, lemon, earth tones and a touch of hay with a dry finish. A very good sour beer.

Botella 75 cl tomada en Cimmeria octubre 2015. Embotellada en 09..03..2015 hasta 03..2025. En etiqueta como cuvee Saint gilloise. Geuze bastante buena con refinados ácidos. Cuerpo medio de 5 vol. Para repetir.

Bottle as "Cuvée de Saint-Guilloise" at Cantillon, Brussel. Aroma of sour fruits, peach, gooseberry, oak, some apricot, funk, some hoppy notes. Flavour is medium to heavy sour with a hint of hoppy bitterness in the dry finish. Body is medium, pleasantly carbonated. Excellent balance and high drinkability. Lovely complex fruity Lambic.

Bottle shared as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise at Gollem Amstelstraat, bottled in February 2014. Hazy, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, white head. Slightly funky, sourish-fruity aroma of lemon, gooseberry, white grapes and oak. Slightly funky, sourish-fruity taste of lemon, gooseberry, white grapes and oak. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent and astringent mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Good!

2012 750ml shared by Ryan. Completely awesome aroma. Peach, apricot..wow, just awesome. Phenomenal world class sour. So much more depth than a US example, nice wheat touches. So good, fruity peach apricot tones. Perfect lambic.

Clear pear apple aroma with a nice funk background, musty, a bit of barnyard and leaf. Taste is your traditional easy going gueuze with a bit less of tartness, with an added dimension of pear and earthy hops, fits very well, and to me best consumed fresher.

Sampled at The Festival in Florida. Cuvée saint guilloiseAroma: lots of flowers, and a bit of sour apples. App: hazy pale, no head. Taste and palate: medium body, vinous, light sweetness, light acidity finish. Great balance.

Hazy straw golden color slight fizz and white head reduces fast. One in mouth tartness, with aromas of white wine and lemon citrus. After initial tartness it fades to the oak and funk. Some barnyard and hay. Very complex finish, great beer.

[2015] 750ml bottle at TDD brewpub. Hazy amber with a frothy white head. Flavors are hay, oak, lemon, grapefruit peel, stone fruits and dust with herbal and funky notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, velvety texture.

From tap at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise 2009. Hazy golden orange color with off white head. Aroma is wood, yeasty, funky, barnyard, plastic notes, citrusy fruity, floral. Sweet and light acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Tap. Hazy orange pour with a thick white head. Green apple, citrus, leather, straw. Crisp, dry and tart. Very nice
Bottle at Bullerup puppen. Pours orange hazy with faomy head. Aroma of funk, tart, light green Apples, light herbs. Very funky dry, tart and bitter taste.

Bottle. Lot #A1234. Colour...lightly hazy amber with a thick white head. Nose... fruity and funky with horse blanket, stinky French cheese. Palate...also quite funky but dry as well and very tart. The mid palate is dry a and the finish is clean, crisp and vibrant.
750ml bottle of St Gilloise bottled March 2013. Pours a golden color with a bit of frothy white head. Wonderful crisp complex flavor. Very dry hop bitterness at the end.

11-SEP-2015, draft @Cantillon, with Ulkløbben.
Hazy yellow with lasting, White head.
Tart, wheat, straw, brett. The hops can be sensed more than tasted. Dry hopped feeling with a Little grass.

Small Saint-Gilloise sample @ Cantillon. Pours golden with long-lasting white head. Both aroma and taste are lemon, green apples and hints of orange. The aftertaste is sour and bitter, being the former more dominant. Light/medium mouthfeel, good carbonation. Nice balanced brew.
St Gill Sample after tour at Cantillon. Poured yellow light orange with min white head. Aroma lemon citrus minor funk yeast. Light carb med bod. Tastes med tart acidic quite lemony. Avg
Bottle at cantillon as st gilloisepale golden with fresh piney herbal nose, Sharp, dry, tart, fresh, clean, refereshing

Glass at Cantillon. Cuvee Saint-Gilloise

Bright gold with a lemony & hayloft aroma. Tart lactic, mildly acidic on a softly carbonated med-light body. Good but I preferred the Faro. Cool being served by Jean though.
Bottle. Golden colour. Aroma hoppy, floral, grapes, bit sour. Taste is i teresting - sourness mixed with hopiness. Grapes. Bit spicy. Bitter/ sour aftertaste. Very drinkable and very good.
Bottle from brewery, kindly donated by friend. Hazy golden color with small white head. Malt, sourn notes, hops in aroma. Sour taste, with grapes, malt, hops in taste. Long sour finish. Tasty.

Bottle. Aroma lemony, citrusy, quite hoppy. Sourness evident but hopams in foreground. Hazy golden colour. Taste is very nicely balanced. Initially lots of sourness and barnyardy, earthy. After a few moments hops comes out - lemony, zesty. Somewhat tart finish. Very interesting, very good.

On tap @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: hazy amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: nice candied fruit nose. Good sour domination and grassy finish. Taste: very nice sour taste. Good astringent. Very nice palate. Really good beer. Finish as sour and grassy. Aftertaste: astringent sour and acidity.

Bottle at Austrian RB Meeting in Linz shared by Sebilinz, many thanks. Aroma of wood barrels, citrus, cider, acid, hops. Hazy orange color, low white head. Flavor is refreshing with cider, citrus notes, ends with citrus peel. leather, herbal hops. Very nice one.

At Cantillon Brewery.
getreidig, zitronig, Zitronenschale, spritzig, erfrischend, schöne Säure in Verbindung mit Hopfenaroma.
750ml bottle beer geek Prague. Orange ok head. Aroma is sour lemon barnyard funk yeast taste much the same bone dry finish nice mouthwatering lip smaker. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Very good this!
Bottle at Cantillon. Clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma medium sour (vinegar), light+ hoppy. Flavor medium sour, well balanced with the biterness of extra hops. Light body. Fantastic.
75cl bottle. Straw gold color. Thin white head. Medium high bitter, medium sour. Flavour is high hop, pepper, brett, grassy, light fruit, citric.

Had this on tap at Cantillon, which is more than worth a visit if youre ever in Brussels, and in bottle. Both were absolutely superb, marrying perfectly traditional gueuze flavours with intense hop character and aroma. Great lemony zest in there too. Refreshing, complex, stunning. Get some if you can.

Cuvée Saint-Gilloise, 750ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours hazy orange with a big but quick-fading white head. Aroma is barnyard, vinegar, floral, malt, citrus - especially lime. Flavour is funky, tart, medium to heavy sour and light saltiness. Medium bodied, thin texture, average carbonation. Finish is sour, dry, citrus and fruits.

Bottle as "Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise", 5%. hazy amber with small white head. Aroma is malt, tart, barnyard, funky and lemon. Flavour is malt, tart, lemon, barnyard, sour, dry, citric, leather, grapefruit and medium bitter.

Bottle. Thanks to Saeglopur. Slightly cloudy orange body with white head. Aroma is wood with tobacco and leather with hints of fruits and grapes. Taste is sour with herbs and hints of malts and some dryness. Aftertaste is sour bitter and malty in the background. Very nice and complex one.

750 ml bottled Jan. 2015 from Saveur Bière, shared at RB Tasting Linz.
Deep orange, hazy body, with a medium, frothy, white head.
Aroma of wood, barrel, barnyard, sweet berries, sour apples and lots of other fruits, basement.
Tastes of funk, dry wood, green apples, pears, sour citrus fruits, overripe fruits, some leather.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, wooden, with pears, sour fruits, leather.

Very tasty. Really complex, with a greatly balanced sourness. Lots of fruits and wood notes. Overall one of the best Cantillons Ive had, just how I like a Lambic.

750ml bottle at Austrian RB Meeting in Linz shared by Sebilinz, many thanks. As Cuvee Saint-Gilloise. Bottled 01/2015. orange / light amber cloudy color, obvious carbonation. medium big white head. smells sour, wood, funk, peach, cork, citric notes. light to medium body, obvious carbonation, light mouthfeel. tastes sour, funk, some wood, peach, grass, herbal, citric, a bit leathery. finishes sour, quite dry and with some funk and wooden notes. overall a tad too dry / sour for me. but still drinks well.

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows funk and horseblanket, melon, elderflower and lemon rind.
Similar flavour; more funk, elderflower, grassy and spicy hops, peach and apricot.
A vibrant delicious beer. Aromas of Orange/red soft fruit. Floral. Flavours are snappy and crisp. Sour, oaky and bitter. Citrus rind. Awesome.

On tap at Akkurat, Stockholm. Pours hazy light amber with small white head. Aroma of lemon, horse stable, effervescent powder, grass. Taste sour and tart, some umami; bitter finish, a lot of aroma coming through.

75cl bottle. Hazy orangish golden colour with a thin white head. Malt, tart, leather and citrus in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter with some vinious and fruity notes. Some citrus and pear in the flavour. Long dry finish. Overall, a very good lambic.

Bière dégustée à la cave de la brasserie Cantillon après la visite des installations brassicoles. Bière jaune et effervescente de laquelle émanent des vapeurs acétiques de raisins, de bois et de houblons. Saveurs très houblonnées et sèches de pomme vert, de bois en décomposition et dun mélange forestier de champignon humide et acide. Arrière goût vineux mais non sucré. Longue en bouche, cette bière est rafraîchissante mais manque de délicatesse à mon avis.

Sample of Cuvée Saint-Gilloise at Cantillon Brewery. Aroma is hoppy herbal notes, funk, acid, leather, vinegar, lemon. Taste is medium sour, very dry and tart. Flavor of lemon, sour apples, herbs, light vinegar, citrus zest. Nice and complex. Aftertaste is sour, tart and dry. Light to medium body and carbonation.
Bottle @ Lukas. Eksamensfest. Hazy orange, big white head, some lacing. malty, tart, sour, lime, fruity, orange, peber.

Bottle. Pours hazy straw yellow with surprisingly nice white head. Aroma is apples, tart, hops, fruits, leaves, sour, funk and mold. Taste is melon and peach sweet at first. Then sour tart, apples, funk, cantillon yeast, moldy. Super dry and slight hoppy finish. Juicy and nice!
Gold pour, 1 finger of head. Tart aroma, citrus peels, light lacto character. Pear, citrus peel, light sweetness. Medium body.

Bottle. Thanks to Seth for sharing this one. Yellow pour with a white head. Funk and lemon zest bouquet. Loads of funk, muted lemon zest, and barrel highlights. Wet hay and straw backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

At Cantillon, bottle as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Pours an amber color with white head. Funk, fruits, some hop spice, tartness, light grass on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry with fruit.

0,75L bottle 2015 vintage as Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise (from beerExpress, Tallinn). Pours amber without head. Aroma is sweet, sour, floral, citrus. Flavor is tart, fruits, citrus. Finish is tart and bitter. Overall: very nice.

Bottle, as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise, bought at the brewery and opened to celebrate my rating #4000 :-) Pours hazy lightish amber with airy but rather stable white head. Intense, vinous aroma, with bitter hoppy notes and some dusty and estery touches. Bitter, hoppy onset, enhanced by perfect dusty notes, gradually replaced by an intense vinous explosion. Very dry finish with vinous notes. Good stuff.
Hazy pale amber, no head. Pours a bit thick. Fruity nose, mild lactic hints, some tartness. Flavor is acidic, fruity, oak, finishes with more fruity acidity. A very nice gueuze.

Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon 150515. [ As Cuvée Saint-Gilloise ]. Fruity and bretty with some hoppy notes, citrusy and crispy, sour and citric, green apples, light to medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.
Bottle at Cantillon shared, 12th May 2015. Slightly cloudy, sour acidic aroma, taste is astringent but very refreshing. Nice Geuze, not my favourite from Cantillon

Bottle shared with daje & edvard at The "Esp0r #2000 Weekend in The Woods" 2014
Orange, hazed, small head. Smell of funk, barnyard, must and some fruity tendensies. Light sweet, quite funky, lemon, lactic acids, medium sour, quite complex. A very nice gueuze!

Poured into a tulip. Bottled 02 November 2011.

3.5 A: Lightly hazed yellow orange color. A little over one finger of frothy white head. Retention is about average and no lacing is left.

4.5 S: What an enticing aroma this has! It smells like the fresh outdoors. Wildflowers, jasmine, running water through a forest, melon, apple orchard. Hay to a lesser extent along with rotting wood. Not very acidic, which isnt really the Cantillon way. Perhaps thats why I like it so much. Fresh outdoors funk with just mild lactic acid. Supremely pleasant. 

3.5 T: Theres more acid in the taste, but its still low for Cantillon - mainly lactic, but also some acetic as well. Herbal bitterness, lots of jasmine again, with a big woody type funkiness. Again wildflower and apple orchard. Sour apple and unripened peach. Hay, dried out campfire wood. Theres a decent amount of astringency in this and its a unique type of astringency, which I will call an acid astringency. Still, pretty good.

3.5 M: Lighter medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Neither spritzy, nor creamy, but it works well enough.

3.5 D: Its definitely one of the funkier Cantillons out there. Its good, but 3F does it so much better. Still, worth a try.


DavoleBomb, Jul 03, 2013

Cuvee des champions 14 vintage

Yields a cloudy, vibrant orange color, with a huge, froth head.

Offers a huge amount of grassy, american hops, giving the beer a unique note, which provides more depth, due to herbal, matured hops. There is a layer of subtle tartness underneath the hops, quite funky, together with leather, yogurt and a whiff of glue. The nose comes perfectly together, between sourness, grass, bitterness and even a fruity indication, leading to a fantastic aroma. 

Has an incredible soft mouthfeel to it, with a fitting carbonation. 

Tastes of leavy, grassy hops with a decent amount of citrus peel, bread and an enjoyable tartness. Blends perfectly into the slightly metallic, lively carbonation, unfolding matured hops among grass and acrid herbs. Finishes with a lively dryness and old hops, while a lot of the grass is still there, evoking an almost fruity impression as the malts tend to get a little sweeter.

As there is a belgian IPA, this in my opinion comes closest to an IPAed lambic . Dont get me wrong, this is unmistakely a lambic, but the hop integration is pretty much character defining. The beer has a highly unusual taste for a lambic, coming incredible well together, with hops doing a huge part of the work, among your typical cantillon lambic foundation. Very rich in flavor, the beer emphasizes a lot subtle flavors, cutting through the matured hops. Reveals a perfect interplay between sour and bitter.

Bottle shared at Bruces farewell drinks. Many thanks to Kenny. As Cuvee Saint Gilloise. Aroma is nice big funk, Brett, light sour, clean. Little pineapple. A little grassy hop on the nose as well. Translucent yellow straw coloured pour with a lasting white fine head. Flavour is composed of wheat grains, grassy hop, sour and crisp, lovely funk, Brett, little pineapple. Palate is crisp , little musty, highish carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle thanks to Jason. 2013 batch of Cuvee Saint-Guilloise. Cloudy orange pour with a small head that fades to a thin ring. Love the aroma. Funky cheese, pulpy orange juice, lemon, oak, and grass. Taste is light to moderately sour. Moderately tart. More orange juice, cheddar, dry leather, hay, grass, light pepper, and light barnyard. I liked this way more than I expected to.

Kveldens siste (og mest særpregede) etter at esben har fått lokk på seg og satt til gjæring: Uklar guloransje og meget kort skum. Betagende besk aroma og smak hvor aprikos, mandarin og bitter appelsinmarmelade er det første jeg tenker på - etter hvert melder det seg også noe honningaktig. Flasken ble så alt for fort tom.

Bottle of Cuvée Saint-Gilloise shared with JMD at HNB 03.04.15. Hazy orange. Small off-white head. Fruity aroma, with sour tropical fruits, marmelade and succade. Similar, and very sour taste. Honey, peach and sour citrus. Wonderful!

2010 bottle, pours a hazy gold with a large light tan head. The smell is tart fruit, funk, yeast. The taste is tart, funky, some bitter hops with a dry ending. The body is light with active carbonation. Great stuff...
This poured a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma was of minerally water, lemon juice, some hay, and dust. Flavor was mild tartness, very earthy funk character and minerally.

Bottle at Hilpeä Hauki. Hazy amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, tart, hops, acidic notes, toast and grass. Sour finish with citrus, acidic notes, hops, tart and grass. Very nice lambic, almost too easy to drink.
Hazy yellow pour. Minimal white head. Aroma of light funk, clay, must, lemon. Taste is lightly sour and grainy. Slightly dry finish. Medium body and medium carbonation. Very well balanced.
Nez frais et rond. Notes de miel. En bouche, acidité légère avec de belles notes grillées, toastées, boisées. Beaux arômes épicés du houblon

2014 bottle.
Hazy amber with a minimal head.
Aroma is vinegary, tart with lots of green apples.
Taste is as above but with quite a lot of wood. 
Light body, low carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Dry and woody after taste.
Not that tart as expected though, could probably have done with some age.

Bottle from Lekkerbier, as Cuvee Saint Gilloise, dated 12 Nov 2012, BB Nov 2022, large sample. Slight hazy golden color, big frothy white head. Aroma is flowery, slight grassy, bit tart, slight funky, bit peppery as well. Soft to medium tartness in taste, slight grassy bitterness. Medium to high carbonation. The flowery and grassy hoppy notes go very well with the clean lambic. Lovely stuff.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Bottle a cloudy golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts sourness fruits apple some hops and sourness flavor malts sourness fruits apple lemon spicy and some hops and sourness in the finish
0,75l bottle @ Pikkulintu. Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is just sour malts. Flavor is sweet acidic malts. Very fine balance. Great!
Draft - Light tart white wine notes, some flower and petroleum. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Tart up front, sweet and herbal, grassy and a bit bitter in the finish. Very dry.

750 ml capped and corked bottle, back label says bottled 24 September 2012, best before September 2022. Labeled as Cuvée St-Gilloise. Served in a Prairie Teku, the beer pours a hazy golden/orange color with about an inch off-white head. Head retention and lacing are both good. Aroma is nice, its smells like apricots, hay, funk, citrus peel and some peppery spice. The brew tastes like citrus (mostly lemon) peel, hay, funk, bready/grainy malt, oak, peppery spice, earthy/floralness, and some white grapes. Theres a nice mix of tartness, fruitiness, and funky/earthiness. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its smooth and easy to drink with a good amount of carbonation. I thought this was good, definitely worth picking up if you come across some!

Pours a light golden with a fizzy white head and decent lacing. Aroma of lemon and cheesy hops with some wild barnyard and oak. Taste is slight tart and lemony with mild pepper and some oak and slight hop character in the finish. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Really good Geueze with well integrated flavors. Pairs well with sharp cheeses.

Color is a clean golden color with a finger of white fluffy head. Smell is funky barnyard, perm, chemical, lemon. Taste is sour rush with some lemon, oak, barnyard funk. Very dry, washes away the sour. Some more of the oak at the end and a little cheese and bread and a very small amount of caramel malt at the end. A well done brew that's hard to peg flavor wise. The majority is the sour barnyard with an old cheese like hops. But those flavors work. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, bright straw color with a fizzy white head. Has a funky lemon pledge smell. Taste is tart an sour with a bit of sweetness underneath. Lemon, cheese and a little band-aidy. Some pepper at the end. Dry mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow, orange, slightly hazy. Nice white head. Tart aroma, brett. Marked bitterness, long duration. Refreshing.

(Cantillon Cuvée des Champions) As Cantillon Cuvee Saint-Gilloise, 750 ml bottle at home, served into a tulip, ABV 5%
Golden orange colour on the body, bright and just a tad hazy, with a tall white head, with okay retention, leaving light lacing around the glass.
Nice floral aromas, some light grapes and wine-y notes as well.
Very sour taste, at least during the first sips, floral notes, light cork/wood, grapes, very nice.
Thin body with good carbonation, very refreshing with a light tartness on the palate.
Good gueuze.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 Vinatge 2014, en fût. Très funky. Une gueuze avec un excellent côté exotique. Très savoureux. Une de mes meilleures de Cantillon jusquà maintenant. Reste à comparer avec la version bouteille qui se fera sous peu.

Bouteille datée du 12/11/2012, bue après exactement 3 ans. Robe orangée plutôt claire surmonté dun épais col de mousse blanc et assez léger. En partant le nez est beaucoup moins intense et fruité que la version fraîche. Beaucoup de lambics, bois de chêne, un fond de poivre moulu, orange, abricot et pamplemousse. Le houblon se fait sentir mais on voit que le houblonnage à froid est chose du passé. En bouche, liquide plutôt acétique. Bien entendu, les lambics dominent mais également des saveurs soutenues de jus de pamplemousse jaune. Beaucoup dorange ausi, mais des oranges pas encore mûres. Aussi, citron, essence de bois et encore cette sensation de poivre moulu. Finale assez sèche où le pamplemousse sattarde. Reste une bonne bière mais doit définitivement être bue fraîche.   7/4/7/3/14 = 3.5/5
Hazy pour at the end of the bottle, bitter citrus rind. Nice funny nose. Soft finish. Nice.
Draft at Big Wood 2014. Pale golden. Beautiful nose. Apricots, funk, and hay, over citrus. Same notes in the flavor, slight herbal/vegetal. Nice and full body. Very tasty!
Apricot color, small white head. Really funky aroma, slightly tart. Really funky and horsey. Great stuff.

Saint Gilloise, bottled January 7, 2013. Pours a clear orange-gold with very small head that subsides. Aroma is very musty, spicy, and earthy, with spicy hops, cork, cedar, and citrus peel mingling with Mediterranean herbs, grass, peach, lemon zest, and autumn leaves. Taste is vinous and juicy but austere, with white wine, orange, and grain fading into serious oak and spicy/bitter hops, with a balanced sourness and faint fruitiness. Finish is quite tannic, with pronounced barrel notes. Fairly low carbonation. Very good.

75cl bottle as Saint Gilloise. Light golden with bubbly white head that leaves a nice looking ring of bubbles. Sour lemon, lemon peel, light grainy and funk, hay. Lots of German style hops, light green raw veggies. Light sour taste with a bitter touch, light sour finish. Great balance and the hops work really well here. Beautiful and complex beer. Love it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at Big Wood 2014 at Brouwers. Bright hazy yellow, white head. Woody softness, creamy sour, round full filling sour. Just bloody tasty.
Very smooth sour. Slightly tart. Melts in your mouth. Barrel comes through but is mild. Could drink all day.
Nice geuze with hop. The hop comes trough in the aroma. Also fruity aroma and taste-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

750ml bottle Cuvee Saint-Gilloise from beermerchants.com. Golden colour, bubbly white foam head and aroma of funk, lemon rind citrus, yeasty. Taste is fruity malt & grain, zesty lemon & grapefruit sour, woody oak, barnyard and some light bitterness. Tangy mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry sour finish. Very drinkable.

Cuvee Saint-Gilliose, from the bottle. Pours golden with a humongous foamy white head that reduces to a layer of foam around one-finger thickness. Aroma is funk and lime. Taste is crisply sour, slightly bitter lemon, tart and a dry finish.

Bottle @ home 20141115. Aroma of green apples, a little funky, some spices and a hint of grapefruit. Taste is mildly sour, with the same components as in the aroma. A slight astringency. Perfectly well balanced, and so light and refreshing.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Aroma has sour apple and yeast. Taste is sour with long aftertaste. Flavors of orange peel, apple and hops. Interesting.

Une bouteille de Cuvée Saint-Gilloise en 750ml. Cest perçant dacidité et de citrons. Il y a bel et bien un côté plus funky, mais le citron est définitivement la note la plus présente dans cette bière. Se boit très bien.
(Cuvée Saint-Gilloise) Corked 75 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemons, brett, oak, and hops - with a dry finish.

Bottle as Saint-Gilloise. Pours hazy dark colourfull orange with a small white fizzy head. Aroma is very funky. Lots of citrus, orange peel, grape, and green apples, some barnyard and leather.. Taste is pretty funky, green sour apples, orange peel, some grape, citrus, more barnyard and some leather.

Tart can be used as a positive descriptor in this case. Split a large bottle with a few friends recently and all agreed it was the best beer of the day. Complex and interesting, pleasant and thirst quenching. Notes of lemony citrus with hints of woodiness. Nice grainy edge as well. Theres a lot going on here and all of it is very enjoyable.

Sample of both 2014 and 2012 bottles at (Hopp)Kurtkeller 016: Cantillon-tastic 01 on 10/11/2014 (as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise). The beer pours a slightly hazed yellow-gold color with a medium foamy white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing on the glass. The aroma is citrus, oak and spice. Light-bodied with flavors of funky citrus, oak and grainy malt. The finish is oaky with a tart citrus aftertaste. Solid beer all around.
Golden with small white head. Aroma is funk, citrus, oak and some floral tones. Fruity palate. Aftertaste is dry, fruity, floral and lingering sour citrus. Overall: nice.

Bottle from De Bierkoning, shared with esp0r & edvard at The "Esp0r #2000 Weekend in The Woods" 2014. Cloudy orange body with a minimal white rim. Aroma of grapes, tart apples, blueveined cheese. Taste of berries, mild sweetness, barnyard funk, light spicy finish, Sweet and sour aftertaste.
Bottle 12 - pours light amber. Lights hopped, lemon zest, and floral notes in the nose. Tart and sour taste with lemon zest, very well balanced. Solid!!!

(2014 Cuvee St.-Gilloise bottle @ barVolo for Zwanze Day 2014, Sept 20 2014) Hazy dark gold with a big lingering white head. Aroma really driven by noble (Halltertau) hops, green and kind of spicy with underlying wheat malt and just a bit of wood and feety funk. On the palate, dry and lightly acidic, lemon zest at first, noble hops kick in later with spicy character, drying, bit woody. Lemon returns towards finish. Hop bitterness, wood, light funk linger. Medium bodied with very high carb. The relatively hop-forward spiciness of this beer is a nice contrast to other Cantillons, but its not so strong as to drown out the essential characteristics of the 2yo lambic underneath. Nice, palate cleansing sort of combination.
Bottle @ Cantillon, as Cuvee St. Gilloise. Golden pour with a small off white head. Nose has funk, mangoes, peach, hay. Taste has funk, lemon, mangoes and some hay. Super good!

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 750ml bottle served in a Thumbler glass.
CuvÃ©e Saint-Galloise purchased @ Mi-orge Mi-houblon - Arlon - Belgium. 
Bottled @ the 17th of February, 2014.
A: Beautiful art, first of all. Cantillon trademark. Corked and capped bottle. Pours a hazy light orange color forming a thin but very fizzy and big bubbled white head that dissipates quickly leaving no lacings at all
S: Very malty and fruity. Very complex. Let me try to describe it: Notes of sweet malts, vinegar, grapefruit, leather, orange zest, honey, peaches, wet grass and flowery hops. A bit earthy in the end
T: Also very complex. Slightly sweet upfront becoming quickly, tart and funky. Moderate sourness, nevertheless. Notes of pale malts, vinegar, grapefruit, leather, orange zest, honey, peaches followed by an absolutely great hops bitterness and finished by some metallic and earthy notes. Lambic yeasts
M: Smooth, bit creamy and a bit molasses body. Fizzy "alive" carbonation. Malty/funky aftertaste
O: Perfect drinkability. Quite hoppy and bitter if compared to a classic Lambic Gueuze. Very unusual and interesting. IMHO, Cantillon is the best brewery of all times...
[ BA Review @ 6/6/2014 ]

"has always been a little too steep to buy a bottle, so when i saw it on tap - had to jump on board. pretty straightforward baryard funk and lemon, with a hint of sweet and dry as well. not a ton going on, but it did tart very well. acidic flavor and feel."
Aromes i sabors típics de lestil, Bretta, làctic. També te molta fruita com albercoc, pera i barreja de citrics com mandarina i llimona. Bona!
750 from Robertdale. Thanks man. Cloudy yellow. Had this right after Iris and the two were very similar. Bitter hops at the end. Some sour. Some floral. Tasty and refreshing.

750 ml purchased at Armsby Abbey before Zwanze 2014. 2012 vintage labeled as Cuvée Saint Gilloies aroma is funky lambic yeast, oak, white grapes and nice floral hints. 
Flavor starts honey, tart lemons and citrus pith. The backend of the sip has pepper and lightly tart fruit. The sourness is subtle and doesnt hurt the taste buds. More tart rather then sour which is pleasing to me. Also shows a weak hint of pine. Jeez for the style this is the best I have sampled to date.
Tap at Scheras Zwanze day. Pours yellowish gold. Big funk smell with barnyard. Great sour taste with some tart. Really good beer.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 On tap at Erzbierschof for Zwanze Day 2014. Gold-orange color with large head. the barnyard aromas are more subtle than with the normal Gueuze. Apples, grapes, tartness, something special in there which I can?t quite describe. Very fruity. Medium body. A good one!2014 vs 2016 sample shared with anstei, shared with some nice Swedes at Cantillon, 4/21/2017. Hoppy, grassy, earthy, apples again. Pretty much as I remember it, for the older one, the younger one hasnt really come together yet, lots of wet cellar in the aroma there.Tap at Akkurat, 6/3/2017. This one has quite a lot of Brausetablette-style funk. It works out better than the young bottle Ive had last month, though.
Tap. Pours bright yellow with white head. Aroma is strong of citrus, grainy, fresh. Taste is very citrusy, very ripe fruit, crisp, tart. Very good.

750 ml bottle labels Cuvee Saint-Gilloise. Bottled 2014. Pours a hazy gold with light head of big bubbles and lots of carbonation.Aromas of sour apples, grapes, wet wood, and funk. Flavors of lemons, green grapes, light malts and oak. Clean, bright, tart and fruity. Excellent.
Bottle as Saint Gilloise. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty very sour aroma. Very sour nice flavor. Long great finish. Oily palate. Nice.

Pours a beautiful copper with a thin white head that lasted about 60 seconds. Slight ring and lacing. Small snifter at the Sybarite Pig. (On draft by the way...)
Aroma is tight with sour fruits (green apples, light citrus, green grapes, starfruit) and funky yeasts. The taste is similar with the sour fruits, funky yeasts, hoppy finish. Damn good. Dry finish, tart on the back-end.

75 cl. bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a tiny, white head. Aroma is sour with herbs, elderflower, hops, citrus, lemon, lime, grapefruit and vinegar. Taste is sharp sour, bitter, vinegar, balsamico, hops, unripe grape peel, sour apple, and is pretty dry. Despite all these crisp, sour and bitter things, the beer has a fairly thick body texture, and a low carbonation. Good stuff for sure!

Opaque orange no foam head. Sour aroma, green apples. Likewise taste. Getting used to. (Elfelling 201408)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy copper with almost no head. Aroma is nice and classic gueuze-like. Lots of wild notes along with fruity notes. I get green grapes, vinegar, green apples, stable, dry champagne, grapefruit, stable leather and weak sulfur. Taste of apple vinegar, grapefruit, weak older hops, green grapes, skunk, weak sulfur and barnyard. Very refreshing and well done gueuze.

Draft at Churckey as St. Gilloise, 7/12/14. Pours a hazy peach color with a medium sized frothy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of soft tartness, stone fruits, peach, white grape. The taste is tart, bright funk, grapes, cherries, stone fruit. Medium bodied, low carbonation, lingering tartness.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, sourness and some sweetness.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl, couleur dorée trouble, joli col de mousse, effervescence importante, une bière assez extraordinaire, beaucoup plus facile à boire quune Cantillon Classique, attaque sur une pointe dacidité citronnée et orangée, et ensuite cette acidité ce mélange à de lamertume type pamplemousse, mais ça continue sur de lamertume du Dry Hopping et là ça devient fou on a une attaque sur le houblon amérisant très forte et ensuite une belle attaque sur les fleurs jaunes et sur les plantes vraiment une tuerie !!
On tap at de Wildeman. Hazy golden with a white head. Sour fruity aroma, barnyard, funky. Taste is vineous, sour fruits, long sour aftertaste. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 Dry-hopped variation on Cantillon geuze, made for a socker club in 2004; also tasted a few days ago under its current alias Cuvée Saint-Gilloise at Grote Dorst. No young lambic, the result being complex as ever, estery, dry, spritzy, woody, lemony, sulphuric and funky as anyone will expect from Cantillon, through which a fresh, bitter hoppiness cuts, both in the nose and in the taste. Great elaboration on the traditional geuze style.

At Justins house warming party. Aroma is classic cantillon funk, fan fucking tastic, fuck yeah light hops. Taste is funky, light acidity, very nice cantillon funk, but not quite up to the very high standard of cantillon.

Draft at Akkurat, October 2013. Pours hazy yellow/goldenish with a quickly settling small white foam leaving a lid on the surface. Very fresh funky (is there such a thing?) aroma of elder-flower, hay, citrus, horse blanket, wood. Taste is a lovely complex one with a moderate sour beginning of citrus and red berries, leaving rooom for a slight rounder feel when some slight hints of elder-flower appear, orange and a slight grape hint, finishing sour and dry. Medium body, soft carbo, oily texture. Very fresh and rich without loosing its typical gueuze-character, lovely.

Bottle. Light hazy golden with a large white head. Herbal and dry flowers, dusty, light barnyard, wooden, lemon, cheese. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and sour. For me this is the perfect pairing for classic moules frites.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2014 as "Cuvée Saint-Gilloise". Gueuze fort portée sur le froment, un peu comme un blanche sure mais avec de la rondeur en plus, et sèche. Le corps doux est assez savoureux: à la fois rond, fruité et biscuité développant des saveurs herbacées des différents houblons. La finale st assez longue, surette et peu amère. Un délice!
On tap at capitol beer and taproom pours golden Orange with white head taste is slightly sweet with a good sour taste amazing

Pours hazy dark golden color with white head. Herbal, grassy, floral and oak aromas with some funkiness. Sour and funky flavor with lemon, oak, grass and some hoppiness. Medium body with lively carbonation.
Clody pale with some floaters. Expected. Very sour tart lemon citrus. Very drinkable with slight brett in finish.
Hazy golden. Small white head. Lemon, oak, hops, sour. Dry. Smooth and funky.

Bouteille 750ml, 2012, sous le nom de Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Couleur orangée pâle voilée, mousse blanche fuyante. Arôme de brett, boisé, acide, vineux, cuir. Goût vineux, brett, boisé, fruité, bonne acidité. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.
Sample at SRBG Grand Tasting. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and floral. Taste is lemon, apple, grape, funk, spice, and wood. Crisp and refreshing.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. This cork : poor quality... An orange opaque light brown beer with a big white head. Big bubbles on the walls, thin in the middle. Smoky aroma, wood, apple, acid, vanilla, herbs. Sourness starts light, then becomes stronger and stronger (dry end). Very light but steady sweetness. Light body, thin texture, soft carbonation, steady dry sour finish. Overall, another great Lambic from Cantillon. Dry hopping adds to the aroma. Nicely done.

750ml bottle. Tasted at RBSG grand tasting. Last pour from the bottle. Totally hazy golden color. Good thin white head. Nice lemony oaky aroma. Great bigger sour aroma, good complex lemon and oak. Medium body. Smooth, kind of creamy lighter carbonation. Wonderful smooth lambic. Some good mild funk on it.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy amber golden, tart, pineapple, fruity and funky.

4 oz draft pour at ChurchKey. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral and herbal notes, oak, Brett. Tastes of tart fruit, floral and herbal notes, citrus, oak, Brett, stone fruit. Medium-light body with a dry and tart finish. Nice!

750 at Beer Kitchen in KC, golden amber body, delicate soapy white head, intense lemon and orange zest, sharp acidic bacterial nature smoothed by lactic and oak qualities, loads of funky character, well balanced complexities

Bottle. Piccola testa di schiuma fine e di rapida dissoluzione, colore giallo chiaro opalescente, aroma interessante e complesso, note di limone, acetico, vino invecchiato, legno, mele acerbe, al palato corpo medio e buona carbonazione , lasprezza e ben bilanciata con la dolcezza dei malti, molto fresca e beverina. Ualtra grande creatura di Cantillon.

On tap at the Paris International Beer Celebration festival during the 1FRBG. Nose is on lambic notes. Aroma is on dry yellow fruits and tart, finish is very dry and acid, lot of lemon. Not my cup of tea.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Ahhhh
Pours a cloudy orange. Light head. Pear sour apple aroma. Thin palate of white Pinot grape and slight oak. Very champagne like dry. Excellent.
shared bottle. poured a cloudy orange colour with a white head. a lot carbonation going on here. a lot of old musky hops on the nose, grapes, earth, tart, vinegar, some old fruits, sour notes.
Color ámbar turbio, espuma Aromas ácidos y afrutados. Cuerpo denso, sabor ácido y afrutado.final seco. Regusto largo. Muy rica

Pours a hazy orange color with a ring of white lace. Very sour and tart aroma of strawberry jam and acidity. Very good flavor of cheese, strawberry jam and barnyard covered by dust and cobwebs with a good acidity and a sweet finish. Light body, dusty texture and very soft carbonation
Probably my favorite Cantillon. Tart apples, lemon, barnyard and funk which goes great with the tiny, tiny spicy note. clean and crisp flavors and extremely sessionable.
Hazy pale body with low head. Aroma has a lot of pear, apple, light citrus, overall fruity, light spicy. Taste has whiskey sweetness with medium fruity sourness. Body is full, high carbonation.

Fantastic stuff, one of my favorite Cantillon Gueuze bottles ever, nice yogurty lemon tartness, surprisingly (or unsurprisingly, given the dryhopping) bitter finish with nice lively carbonation that doesnt overwhelm into champagne territory. Great stuff.

Corked and capped 750 ml bottle from Tipples dated July 4, 2013. Pours hazy tangerine colored with a small white fizzy head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of vinegar, oak, hay, sour apples, lemon peel, wet dog, maybe a little mango pineapple tropical thing going on here. Flavor is sour oaky vinegar, dust, juicy tangerines and other tropical fruits, grass. Low to medium body, low carbonation, finishes dry. A nice beer, but maybe a tad unexciting.

Bottle is 2009 vintage. Thanks ahalloin! Pours a hazy golden blonde, with a thin sponge head. Aroma is classic sourness - lemon zest, apple tartness, vinegar acidity, well-balanced. Flavor is phenomenal - perfectly balanced... tart green apples with slight vinegar in the finish. From notes 2/15/10.

Bottle purchased at the source. 2 1/2 months young. Pours orange gold with a white head. Aroma is very floral, some citrus, some wet cardboard. Flavor is tart, lemon, white grape. Slight graoefruit skin bitter in the finish.
Fragrant aroma with sour tones. Nice color not to dark. Overall a very nice beer to drink.

Unclear golden with a great, dense frothy head. Very yeasty. Lots of Barnyard. Really soft. Really nice sourness that builds with each passing moment. Balanced fruitiness. Lemon. Medium body. Nice and dry. Really soft. Really tasty!! So easy to drink... I liked this a lot.

Bottle shared with our Mes in my new local The Wharf, Macclesfield, Cheshire. Ace pub. Pale slightly cloudy yellow gold with a thin quickly fading white head. Aroma is funky and tarty gueuze awesomeness. Flavours has lemons, orange, gueuze stuff. Perfectly placed in the late middle of our session. A joy to drink. Lovely stuff.

Ive had the pleasure of trying many iterations of dry-hopped Cantillon lambic- from the exemplary variants (Bier Circus Cuvee du 89, Monks Cuvee, Pikkulintu) to legacy Cuvee des Champions, to the current Cuvee St. Gilloise, the use of dry hopping makes for a very tasty and profound example of the possibilities of lambic production melded with other brewing staples. Hops tend to fade sharp and fast, however even in the decade old renditions, there is still evidence of the bitterness and hop oils present. Hazy, translucent pour with a nice head and minimal lacing, heavy acidity and slick profile from residual hop oils..Very similar to the single cask two year lambic, Cuvee combines the flatness of jonge lambic with the budding funk and acidity that comes with age. Two year was an ideal pick to dry hop, and the evidence is clear in this refreshing and savory pour.
Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Sour and fruity aroma and taste.
@ Cantillon Quintessence. Hazy yellow colour, a lot of carbonation. Sour beer with notes of green apples. Dry and hoppy finish.

Hazy yellow with a small pale head. Aroma is grapefruit peel, peach stone, aged cheddar, barnyard funk. Light bodied, a little soft on the palate with restrained tartness. Taste is citrus peel, tart peach, dried citrus peel.

Sampled at DLD 2014. It poured a hazy amber color with a small off-white head. The aroma was of tartness, funk, some light fruits and more sourness. The taste was the same with a nice tart finish. Tasty.
