A millisecond of a n unpasteurised Hallertau/Bavarian pils nose tricks the palate into thinking its up for something mild and bland before the well-tempered tartness pierces through like August sun through damp clouds, received on the earthy lemon cake malt base. Mitigated aka cultivated Cantillon sourness, exquisitely balanced finish. An unusual, fascinating drink even by Cantillon standards.
Golly it sure is sour. I get some cheese with my wine. It is niiiiiice like a Borat imposter just said here at DLD 2014.

Draught @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa, Rome. As Cantillon St. Gillios Pours light golden with a fading white head. Aroma is sour, brett, barnyard, wood, grapes, sour green apples. Flavor of sourness, yeast/brett, wood, barnyard, green grapes, citrus, green apples. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting acidic finish. 080414

Bottle @ Irreale. Pale golden and hazy colour with a white head woth short duration. High presence of yeast in the aroma, also a good presence of brettanomycces are present with slightly citrus. Flavor is quite similar as aroma with a long acidic mouthfeel, bretts are highly present. Acidic final with a mild dry mouthfeel.
Bottle. Light hazy golden with a large white head. Herbal and dry flowers, dusty, light barnyard, wooden, lemon, cheese. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and sour.

Poured a medium and cloudy orange color with a smaller sized white head. Aromas of horseblanket, leather and musty. Tastes of green apples and light lemons. Nice lighter sour and tart finish. Very good
Golden color. Loads of tartness in the aroma. Some acidity. Light bodied and really refreshing!

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Sour, brett, hay, wheat.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, fruit, orange, rather sweet.

Birra davvero eccezionale, con unacidità intensa ma meno invasiva rispetto a molte altre gueuze, accompagnata da profumate note floreali, erbacee e una sfumatura citrica, finale lievemente amarotico che si intreccia con una punta acida, secca e dal tono legnoso molto molto accattivante. Superlativa!!

Pours a heavily hazed golden with a medium white head that leaves really good lacing. Nose is hoppy and funky, woody. Freshly cut hay. Taste is tart but not too much, dry. Noble hops flavors and wheat, lemony. Finish is herbal and lightly bitter. Acidity is really well controlled, body light and carbonation moderate. This drinks really, really well. One of the classiest Cantillon out there, yum!

Draft. A very tart nose up front. Kinda flat pour. Minimal to no head. Taste is just tart with not much complexity. A light barnyard character but not much else. Tasty but Im not sure Id pay high prices for this again

A - pours hazy light apricot with a light ring of head. S - ooh funk-y! Musty wet oak. Almost cheese funky. Orange blossom. Wet musty orange grove in the rain. With a nice urinal cake! M - tart. Thin and wet mf with a dry bitter end. T - musty lemony/orangy juice. Wet oak. Floral and citrus. Funky eggy awesomeness. Dank musty hops as well. O - a nice loon. 4.0

Bottle thanks to Eric. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a thick frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is a strong funk, feet, rubber. Medium mouthfeel with strong funk, cheese, pepper, and lingering dry finish. Good.
tons of cat pee, sour dry estery, with apricots. Dry, balanced, sour and good, unfortunately my notes on this one are crap.

750ml bottle. 2013 vintage. Aroma-wow, lots of funk, citrus, bleu cheese, pepper. A lot going on here. Poured a hazy straw color with no head, minimal carbonation. Taste-again, wow. Sour, tart, funky, mild citrus sweetness. As it warms flavors of spice and white pepper peek through. Finish stayed with me for hours. Lucky to try this. Simply amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy gold pour, white head. Little retention/lace. Aroma of funk, citrus, grass, dust, earth, wood. Taste is moderately bitter, tart, lactic, citrus, grass, earthy, tangerine. Palate is dry, average carbonation, bitter/tart finish.
Had at the BGoA Winter tasting. Pours a light yellow. Hazy. Funky and yeasty. This was the 2012 version. Slightly dirty diaper. Nice.

Bottle in Craft Brixton shared by Ange. Pours a young looking bright hazy amber with a white foam head. Nose is sour, tart, green apples, orange citrous, musty grain, slight funky sourness, but its very fresh (didnt check the bottling date), barnyard, white wine vinegar. Taste is acidic, tart, sour, citrous, green apple, white wine vinegar, nicely balanced with musty grain malt, barnyard funkiness, and hoppy grassiness and citrous. This is really fresh and well balanced. Very good.

Bottle from Mane Liquor Formal-wear , cheers to navarre. Pours vibrant cloudy orange with a thick white head and heavy lacing. Immediate hit of hay, grass and lemon on the nose. Flavours are superbly balanced - lots of fresh grass, lemon, orange, sherbet and a refreshing lacto sourness. As it warms, funky barnyard notes really shine and the sour settles down a bit. Getting a slightly cheesey flavour now too. Dryness lingers, thirsty for more. Not let down!

12/26/13. 750mL bottle (from Grassroots) shared at the QC tasting, labeled as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Hazy golden orange pour with a nice off-white head that sticks. Nice aroma, lightly tart, plenty funky, some vinegar and barnyard aspects. Nice flavor as well, again plenty of funk and barnyard, touches of vinegar, straw, hay. Tasty.

Pour is hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is quite tart with notes barnyard, fresh cut grass, citrus, and honey. Flavor is very similar with a huge dry finish. A bit of fruit in the aftertaste. Thin body and slick mouth-feel.

Bottle. Clear golden colour, small white head. Aroma is great, light funk, bit of cabbage (?!), citrus. Taste is really nice, very drinkable, nice tartness, grapefruit, lemon, light creaminess. Probably left it too late for the hoppy bits but still lovely.

Bottle shared by drowland, pours a cloudy light gold with a thin head, the aroma is of tons of vinegar and funk mixed in with some barnyard and earthy notes, kind of musty but still sour and fresh at the same time, the flavor has a good amount of vinegar and sour fruit on the front end with a little bit of the must in the finish, dry in the finish but still really bubbly in the mouthfeel, tart through out, awesome.

75cl bottle. Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is big barnyard, hay, funk, citrus and vinegar. Quite acidic. Young bottle (4 months) but already pretty sour! Mild sweetness aswell. Lovely. Maybe a bit rough. Lots of flavours going on though. Medium bodied. Great!
Bottle, pours a light browny yellow, aroma is nice funk and taste is so as well, a very nice tartness to this one, overall very enjoyable, thanks scott

Bottle @ Epic Sour Sourpuss Tasting, thnx to non-RateBeerians. Pours a clear blonde beer with a thin white head on top. No lacing going on, decent carbonation. Aroma is barnyard, horse blanket and other typical gueuze aromas. Some funky Brett characteristics as well. Flavor is medium sour, well balanced and even a sweet touch to it. Prickly mouthfeel, well carbonated and has a short, bitter sour aftertaste. Nice one.

Bottle shared at the epic sour sourpuss tasting. Pours hazy golden with a small off white head. Aroma is massive horse blanket and barnyard funk up,front, earthy, tart fruits. Flavor is light heavy acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle, thanks Stu. Hazy amber gold with white head. Funky lambic aroma, some lemon and vinegar. Taste is sharp and funky, lemon. Tart with a long moderately sour linger. A fine gueuze

Draught @ Akkurat as St Gilloise. Pours a hazy medium straw, with a thin white head. Bone dry, medium bodied, low bitterness, balanced CO2. Funky, spicy taste, brett, lemon peel, hay, earth, apricot, dried fruit. Not as tart as the other lambics from Cantillon, but just as balanced and complex. And this is rating #666 for this beer - how metal isnt that? (2013-12-12) ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle @ #HPJ-13, thanks bluus. Pours a slightly orangey yellow, cloudy, small white head. Aroma is acidic and sour. Appleskin and bile. Taste is much of the same. Acidic, sour and quite dry. Appleskin, some barnyard. Finishes with dry and sour appleskin, a bit of citrus. Sparkling, acidic, fairly light, but definitely not watery. Very enjoyable.
750 ml bottle. Little carbonation that builds. Yellow hazy body. Tart. Apple. Grapes. Lemon. Tang that lingers.
Notes from backlog. High on acidity, a lot of fruit, hay, and a touch of vinegar

Tap at Blind Tiger as part of VSK madness. Pours cloudy orange gold with white head. Nose is quite tart with some funny cheese as well. Tastes sour and acidic of clementines, apricot, wood, wheat, and a touch salty. lot of flavor with nice round mouth feel.

Bottle from bieresgourmet.be webshop. Pours a clear deep golden body with a large foamy white head and a lot of visible bubbles in the glass. Nose is mild citric acid tones, herbs, wet grass, hay and hints of horseblanket and grape peel. Taste is dry horseblanket tones, bitter herbs, lemon peel and hints of grape peel and gooseberries. Dry, light body, high carbonation. Quite nice "geuze" with a bitter touch, but not as complex or intriguing as many other Cantillon creations.
On tap at Biercab. Hazy golden colour with white head. Fruity, sour and lactic aroma. Sour, fruity and lactic taste, also acidic. Light to medium body.
On tap at Akkurat. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is lemon, tart, hay, leather, earthy and floral. Taste is acidic with a lemon touch, light floral notes, finish is tart gooseberries.

Appearance: Cloudy golden color with a small white head.Aroma: Sour and fruity.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sour/acidic and a balanced bitterness. A bit soft carbonation.Taste: Mild sour and balanced acidic. Fruity and a very dry texture.Overall impression: Tasty and nice.Personal stats: Bottle as Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise @ Geokkjer
Pours gold. Light nose of funk. Taste is sour, lemons, light sweetness undulates. slight drying in the finish.

On tap at Churchkey. Light yellow pour. Woodsy and herbal on the nose, possibly from the dry hops? Flavor is a tart punch in the mouth. Hugely tart gives way to soft hop bitterness and some more of the earthy woodsy hop character. This thing is a beast.

Botella. Presencia limpia con corona blanca poco persistente. Aroma ácido, cuero, levaduras y champan. En boca acidez pronunciada, cuadra, final corto y seco. No encuentro el lúpulo que pone que lleva en la etiqueta

On tap @ In De Wildeman as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Cloudy yellow color. Not much head. Aromas: true lambic: sour, wood, wheat, only a little brett (phew). Flavor is sour with a moderate bitter bite. Light bodied. Delicate bitter finish. Well done.
Aroma is yeast, sour wood, some slight vanillaish notes. Flavour is quite wellbalanced sourness, wooden and mild notes of fruityness.

Aroma: Dank, Funky, Barnyard

Appearance: Murky Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Hay, Apricots, Mild Peach

Mouthfeel: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Funky, Mildly Tart
Hazy golden color with white head. Nice fresh herbal and floral aroma, also sour. At taste is light sweet and smooth and sour.

Pours hazy orange. Aroma is funk, citrus, dew grass, soil, resin. Taste is funk, citrus, honey, apricot, mango. Quite carbonated and very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of tart, horseblanket, barnyard and fruits. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, sour and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with an off-white head.Aroma of herbal hops, cheese, some funk and sour berries. Flavor is sweet and sour with some cellar notes,lemon, sour berries and funk. Medium body, average carbonation.

Fad: lysegul diset med et lille skumhoved. Duften er syrlig smule stald og en del vindrue og grape.Champagne upfront i smagen, med en smule grape. Den går over i en mere traditionel geuze. Virkelig en dejlig frisk øl.

Tap. Pours hazy orange golden with a medium sized, creamy white head. Acitric aroma with wood, spice, brett, hoppy notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up quite tart. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. An excellent brew.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 Bottle: thanks, Mike! Somewhat translucent, golden-yellow with a huge, foamy, eggshell tinted head that fizzles up nicely and leaves some chunky lacing behind. Aroma is funk city; cheesy, musty barnyard, horseblanket, wet hay, & old cork. Funk is accompanied by some herbal lemon zest, grass, leaves, and a mildly abrupt tartness with apples, white grapes, & lemons. Taste starts with nice fruity tartness; some more apples with pears, white grapes, & light peach notes. Very tart and jolting. Very apparent funk - musty, damp cellar, corky, & barnyard-esque. Some sweaty & cheesy notes on the back-end with fading, effervescent fruit skins. A very nice & highly drinkable gueuze with incredible funk.

750ml bottle as Cuvee Saint-Gilloise. Pours a hazy medium gold, with a large off-white head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. Dusty leather, oak, dried flowers, preserved lemon and plenty of sour funk make up a complex aroma. Moderate citric sourness up front leads into a softer, rounded mid-palate, with stonefruit notes and smooth oak coming through. More assertive sourness and a touch of leather appear in a dry finish. This is a bit softer and smoother than a lot of gueuzes, but with plenty of complexity and flavour still. A thoroughly enjoyable gueuze.
750ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy gold with a thin head. Aroma is light tart lemon and barnyard notes. Taste has tart lemon to start. Extremely sour finish with cheesy barnyard notes.

Bottle sample at Holy Grale for Zwanze Day 2013. Clear gold in color with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, florals and some vinegar. Malty flavor with vinegar character before an earthy and floral hop finish.

Hazy orange yellow in color... Aroma of barnyard funk, dirty socks.... Flavor is crisp, light bodied, watery lemons, pure funk throughout .. Interesting, solid sour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught as Saint Gilloise for Zwanze Day 2013 at Avenue Pub! Pours a hazy orange brown with little to no head or lacing. Aroma is citrus sweetness, sour funkiness, and a hint of bready grain. Taste follows, refreshing and light, not overpowering sour, but nicely done.

Bottle graciously shared by someone at DL Day. admittedly my notes are chicken scratch at best but this was a lightly sour, slightly funky gueuze that wasnt overpowering. Fairly easy to drink. Enjoyable.

On tap @ Nuetnigenough. Apparently a special cask that first went bad before the yeast could kill the bacteria? In any case, this is good! Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of grapes, apple, yeast, earth, hints of hay and grass. Very pleasant sour taste, distinct tart but smooth towards the finish. Nice lingering sourness. Light, crisp body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Monks in Philly. Dated 19-Nov-2012. Cloudy orange pour. Very slight fizzy/foamy head. Took a little while to open up. Unripe orange peels. Peach pits. Wild strawberries. Great deep oak notes. Tart and wonderfully complex. Medium body. Bitter citrus finish. Opens to lots of dancing floral notes in the finish.

Another great Cantillon. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Lots of bretta and grapefruit with some crackery grain aromas here. Bitter finish with light sourness as well. Characteristic of brewery. Very nice. Bottle at Volo for Zwanze Day.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 8oz draught pour during Zwanze Day 2013 at Novare Res in Portland, ME on 9/14. Bright cloudy yellow gold with no head. Nose is orange rind, tart, fruit, acidic notes. Mouthfeel is flat, wine-like, smooth. Taste is tart grapefruit, pineapple, lemonade, orange, clemetine, fruity, lemon, wheaty, funky, honey, barrel notes. Finish is sour up front and gives ways to a sweet citrusy fruitiness. Very good.
Bottle. Hoppy, gueuzey, bitter yeast, more hops. Bone dry on the palate. Lightly tart and funky. Low carb helps it go down easy. Tasty!
Bottle share by Bryce, Great sour funk, some pear and apricot. Taste some mildly sour funk, almost a creamy feel in the back.

Draft at zwanze. Murky apple juice light amber. Aroma: sweet funk, dirty diaper. The usual. Taste: great tart and funky - fruity, musty, earth. Lasting cantillon not just sour not just funk finish. Sweetened grains emerge eventually. Medium body, slick coating texture, average, prickly carbonation. Overall: yum give me more fizzy dirty diaper please.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 On tap before Zwanze day. Pours hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma of tarness and funk, some light fruits, and Some more sourness. Flavor the same with a nice tart finish. Average texture. A good beer.
Edit: 750ml bottle in a teku. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of sourness and funkiness, light malts, floral hops, and some light grapes and fruits.  Flavor the same with a nice blend.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 Poured from a bottle at Churchkey DC on Zwanze Day. Pours a hazy pale gold. Some funky cheese in the nose. Flavors of white and green pepper, leather with a hint of hop bitterness. Nice.

June 12, 2004.  On draft at ChurchKey DC.  All of the above but more of a tangy finish.  Lovely beer.
Pours a bright orange with a white lacing. The hop notes have faded with age and are now stale. Hints of brown sugar.Moderate sourness.

On bottle at Olympen. Golden slightly hazy color, ok foam. Very good aroma intensity. Some stable aromas 
Medium body & complexity . Good intensity sourness and some bitterness . Very enjoyable .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a light golden yellow color with aromas of light lemon, tart wood, some candi sugar and musk. Flavors are the same, light on the palate, quite enjoyable to grill with this beer outside. Would love to have more.

We got about 3 dozen Cantillon beers in at work, 3 days later there were only 2 left. Bought the last 2 myself. 

Pours deep golden orange with a 1-finger head that soon dissipates. 

Smells of tart, sour lemon and yeast. Notes of vinegar. 

Confronting - not for the uninitiated! Smooth lemons upfront, funky farmhouse fruits that dry out over the tongue. The hops suck the moisture out of your mouth on the way down, challenging, but becomes very enjoyable as the drink opens up. 

A light body with a lot of carbonation. 

Not usually one for the style, but I couldn't pass up the chance! Looking forward to my bottle of bio lambic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: lemony/acidic notes, some spicy hops, earthy and slightly musty, yeast. 
Appearance: hazy light golden pour, white head with below average retention, little lacing.
Taste: nice balance of sour, spicy/earthy hops, and Brett character. Acidity is firm but controlled, some musty/sweaty Brett notes, a light touch of spice and citrus. 
Palate: light body, medium carbonation. Dry and refreshing finish.
Overall: nice brew, well balanced and drinkable.
From tap at Søernes ølbar. As Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Cloudy golden with a creamy white head. Wood. Citric. Balsamic vinegar. Gooseberries. Soap. Tart applejuice. Leomoncurd. Funk. Gamle Ole. Love it.
Pours orange with little to no head. Smells of sour and yeast. Tastes of sour, with very light bitter and low carbonation.
Different gueuze than what Im used to. Due to the hopping, this one actually has some bitterness. Its still vey sour of course, but with a touch of normal beer taste.

Murky yellow, medium head. Smells.. Fruity in a tart way..the bret yeasts too also a little hops. Tastes..a smooth tart / sour, slightly fruity and with a slightly bitter hop ending. Really easy sour to drink and enjoyable.

Aroma is yeast, sour wood, some slight vanillaish notes. Flavour is quite wellbalanced sourness, wooden and mild notes of fruityness. Not that killing tartness/sourness. Easy to drink and quite mellow.
Hazy honey with no head. Aroma of tangerine and grass, very flowery. Taste of firm sourness, wheat and wine, orange rinds, bitter finish
On tap @Akkurat. Golden with white head. Aroma of fruit, citrus, malt and yeast. Taste follows with similar notes; fruit, citrus, yeast, malt and funk. Very well balanced, pleasant to drink

Source : Office des Grands Crus (SAQ)
Appearance : Golden amber with medium head.
Aroma : Citrus and Sour.
Taste : Sour with a metallic finish, the finish is cause by the dry-hop in cask.
Palate : Medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall : Ok beer compared to other Cantillon.

Slightly hazy golden amber. Peach like smells lightly come through the wet barn yard aroma. Smooth yet vegetative start that tarts out and fades tingly away. A funk sour that catches you first under your nose then in the jowls.
Bottle. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is leather, brett, stable, straw, malt and hops. Nice-

From tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a hazy yellow color with dense foam. Nose is incredible with lemon, grapefruit, citrus peel, acid turning to funk, and some dried hops. Palate is dry and bright, but also somewhat rich with flavors of bitter citrus peel, dried flowers, must, a bit of oak, and just a hint of hops. Not sure if it was because of where I was drinking this, but I really enjoyed it.
Bottle at Saint Bock, Montreal. Light amber body. Not as sour as some other guezes, but nice sweet aroma, vinous tart taste.
Bottle..Pour is yellow with a thin white head..Nose is funk, tart, socks, lemon peel..Taste is tartness, dryness, funk, sweetness, horse blanket...

Bottled in 2010. Swietne gueuze. Wytrawne goryczkowe i przede wszystkim niesamowicie kwasne. Takie wlasnie powinno byc dobre gueuze. I choc jest odrobine mniej kwaskowate niz Fou Foune ktore niedawno degustowalem jest rownie wysokiej klasy lambickiem. Konska derka wyczuwalna, nuty mokrego drewna, trociny i wilgotna skoszona trawa. Lekki aromat chmielu wystepuje takze. Debowe i drewniane posmaki takze sa intensywne. W zasadzie kazdy element smakowo-zapachowy jest bardzo wyraznie przezemnie wyczuwalny. Do tego swietnie sie pieni i jest dostateczne metne.
Bottle at Olympen. Golden-orange colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, citrus, yeast. Flavour is fruit, citrus, yeast, funk. Flavour is funk, fruit, citrus, yeast. Very nice beer.

750 ml bottle. Pours a lightly veiled straw with a resilient white head. Aroma is lemon, yeast, old. Flavor is tart candy, a touch of fruit. Extremely dry. Finish is lemon, oldish, brett funk, tart. Lingering dust and lemon peel. Light to medium body, prickly mouthfeel, average carbonation. Refreshing, but I felt it somehow lacked complexity.
Bottle from BrewDog; hazy golden amber pour with thin white head, typical funky aroma, taste has funk slight metallic brett, grassy and faint lemon.

On-tap at Ebenezers Pub and served into wine glass of sorts on 07-11-12.

Pours a darker golden color, thin collar, sticky lace, thin whispy cap. Light sour tart, slight funk, barn, hay. Im really surprised there isnt the hoppy notes I remember from the bottle. Truthfully, I didnt enjoy them all that much, just surprised theyre gone from this one on-tap. Chris called this "Cantillon Light". I think thats pretty much true. Tastes like a "light gueuze", hops, light tart, sour, funk, oak, barn, slight funky dry finish. Light body, good carbonation, dry finish.

Very enjoyable and very easy to drink. I had two of these and my fiancee had another...a perfect beer for the summer. Really enjoyed this one on-tap much more then from the bottle. Recommend!

Tried a smallish sample in a group tasting. Poured a pale yellow, bubbly with a little lace. Aroma is funky barnyard, with some mild fruit and vinegar acidity smell. Taste is mostly very sour but very mild. Not the crazy tartness but a solid good sourness. It is so full and tasty, maybe a little wood in there as well. What an amazing beer!

The appearance is beautiful overall with the orange colour coming fromthe significant dry hopping. The aroma has a mild peppery and spicy hop aroma with a bone dry almost Champagne like aroma with tons of hop nuances. A light barnyard funk pervades the aroma with noted tart lemon fruitiness and acetic sourness. Although I have had many different gueuze the aroma always surprises me with its acidic backbone and tart, dry notes. The first sip I take has an intense citrus fruit to the point of puckering tartness until a mild oaky creaminess settles the citric flavour down a bit. The finish is crackingly dry with a mild bitterness from aged Golding hops with nice solid sourness. Funky fruits and barnyard yeasty esters are rather subtle as the acetic acid, dry hops and citrus fruits are much more abashing on the palate. Overall a nicely soured, complex Gueuze with a creaminess that balances out the dry, acidic flavour profile.

On cask at Chez Moeder

Trying Cantillon on cask was an interesting experience. The normal aspects are replaced by the stillness of being on wood. For this particular beer it works decently although I would still much rather have a bottle.

Aroma / Appearance - The bronze base is masked by a cloudy nature as if overcast. Starchy and peppry, it has the feel of a bone dry champagne. Icy lemons spread over a generous piece of cheesecake give it a gueze feel but not that familiar vinegary bite.

Flavor / Palate - The oaky aspect of the cask leaves a mild bitterness on the tip of the tongue. It is then washed away by the combination of hops, lemons, and light tartness. The creamy nature of the mouthfeel is similar to drinking a lemonade based smoothie with floral hints. This is a fine beer overall but at least on cask not the best.
On tap at La Capsule, Lille under the name Cantillon St. Gilloise. Yellow a bit brownish with white cap, cloudy. Nice sour taste with bitterness afterwards. Reminds also cider.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2013 Bottle. First pour: Clear yellow straw with white head. Aroma: classic cantillon, funky, barnyard, brett, some lemon, perfumy, also some hops ion there, fruity, hay, smells nice! Taste: nice sourness with lemon, apples, funk, hay and a slight bitterness at the end. Small hop prescence. A very nice Cantillon, as always!

Aroma: Stable, leather, fruit, vinegar.Appearance: A foggy straw colored beer. A low white head with small lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet fruits, lemon peel, tea and grape-fruit seeds.Palate: Low carbonation, a fresh texture. A medium body with a slightly dry finish.Overall: Brilliant and balanced.Note: Bottle 750 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2013-06-15.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2013 Beer Gonzo, Coventry. 750ml bottle- maybe the most expensive Ive bought in the UK. Clear lager gold-to-hefeweizen-hazy with an enduring white foam. Have Cantillon gone all soft and namby-pamby and started brewing beers I actually enjoy?? Pussies. Aroma dank old lime and lemon left in the fridge a couple of weeks; deep cream of oak, champagne cork; freshly pissed-on urinal cake. Mellow, discreetly puckering lime, green apple and cream cheese/yoghurt-sharp taste with a cheesy old hop bitterness loitering in the background. Its got that balance, creaminess and more-rounded-than-bone-dry lime jelly thing I associate with Drie Fonteinen. Good dry hop and curry leaf on the burp. World class lambic sessions. If there was a pub at the end of my road with this on handpull Id be down there like a shot. Worth every penny.

Dry hopped Cantillon gueuze, must I say more?  Excellent beer with a great mouth-feel and all around satisfaction.  Typical tart, acidic gueuze flavor is complemented by a bitter, light citrusy punch.
Pours a hazy blomd with white head and no lacing. Aroma of funk, barnyard, grassy hops. Taste is funk, horseblanket, oak, litghtly vinous, grassy finish. Low body and low carb. Very good

2011 750mL pours a hazy golden/orange with a medium white head. Pretty mellow aroma, oranges, lemon zest, and barn yard. Taste is very tart and sour, lemon zest, oak, lots of funk, dry earthy hops on the finish. Yum!

A - Slightly hazy golden-orange with a finger of frothy white head. Fades normal.

S - Sweet wheat, oak, vanilla, barnyard funk, tart green fruits, lactic acid, citrus hops, lemon zest, light sourness.

T - Sweet wheat, oak, vanilla, barnyard funk, tart green fruits, lactic acid, lemon zest, light citrus and floral hops, light sourness.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a funky, tart, sour finish.

D - Fantastic balance and complexity, the hops are a great addition.
Bouteille 750 ml. Arôme d jus de pomme acidulé, de barnyard, de houblon. Fruité en bouche, bonne acidité. Excellent équilibre, rafraîchissante. Une bien bonne gueuze.
Draught @ GCB: Very interesting and deep gueze with a more approachable palette than most Ive had.

Shiny golden body and no head (after a fizzy few seconds). Bit of herbal hops, fruity sourness, not overly complex. Light sweet, fuller sourness, especially towards the end. Okay palate yet not much complexity. Drinks well enough. Okay, bit simple, geuze. (75cl bottle from Bierparadijs)

2012 bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is grain, funk, some pear and a good amount of sour. Taste is dry, slightly hoppy for a gueuze with some fruit going on that is hard to pick out, hay and some other barnyard. Not overly sour.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Doften av gammal humle är det första jag tänker på även om den är dämpad. Frisk och härlig. Ganska låg syra jämfört med andra cantillon.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 Spina @ Porckn Beer 2013
Chiara, torbida, schiuma persistente.
In bocca e al naso acida e luppolata.
Finale lungo ed amaro.
Particolare, buona!

Bouteille 750ml sous le nom de "Cuvée St-Gilloise", courtoisie de mathieuc. De couleur dorée foncée et opaque. Nez de levures sauvages fruitées sûres (pommes vertes sûres, moyen de citron, traces de raisins verts), terreuses et légèrement rustiques, légèrement boisé (bois humide) avec des notes de houblon floral. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement doux mais croustillant ainsi quune texture aux notes cidreuses. Goût de levures sauvages fruitées moyennement sûres et acides (citron, léger de pommes vertes, notes de raisins verts) aux notes terreuses et rustiques lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un léger goût boisé (bois humide, traces de fût de chêne) ainsi quune légère amertume de houblon floral aux faibles traces citriques (pamplemousse) et herbeuses en finale. Post-goût moyen et plutôt sec, composé dun goût moyennement aigre de levures sauvages fruitées (zeste dagrumes, notes de moût de raisins verts et de pelures de pommes) avec des notes boisées et des notes de houblon floral et herbeux.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of citric fruit, barnyard and brett. Very high carbonated. Taste is wood, crisp and tarty with a short aftertaste, refreshing and easy to like this one.
Buona si ma tra le lambic è una di quelle che mi ha entusiasmato meno.
Chilled bottle, thanks to Josh, poured into a tulip.  Pours golden with little white head.  Medium body, low carbonation, and tart aroma.  Taste is good sourness.  Good beer.
750 ml bottle shared at a tasting. Pours a pale gold with no head. Aroma is earthy sweet. Taste is sweet and fruity with a solid acidity.

Location: Bottle shared by NickD717, 3/16/13


Aroma: The aroma is bretty and fruity, with some wood, funk, and some yeast notes as well

Appearance: This one pours a medium golden color with a white head and a good amount of lace

Flavor: Tastes much like the nose suggests, funky, a little sweet, a little tart, and mildly bitter

Palate: The body is light-medium, it has a complex mouthfeel, and a fairly fizzy carbonation

Overall Impression: 
Thanks for sharing this one Nick!  Unsurprisingly, this one is very good.  Im pretty excited to have gotten a chance to try it, and I would certainly be happy to drink it again.

Bottle at home with my wife, why? Why the fuck not? Pour is hazy orange with a bright white head and great lacing. Big citrus, spicy hops, lemon peel, funk, must, sweet tarts, green apples, cranberries, grapefruit juice, hay, and lacto in the aroma. Taste is medium, sour and a touch hoppy, with notes of lemon peel, pears, green apples, light horseblanket, dough, earthy hops, vanilla, lactic acid, cheese, and citrus with a medium sour finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Really nice Gueuze.

Bottle - 2011. Pours clear golden amber with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is funky, fruity with notes of horse blanket and a bit of urine. Flavor is the same with a light fruity sweetness and a surprisingly light tartness. Light body, a bit champagnelike; kind of a starter gueuze, actually.

375 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100207.
Pours golden color with a minimal head. Aroma of sour fruits, yeast and some wooden notes. Flavor of yeast, sour fruits, toffee, grass and some goose berries. Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Mild funk and lemon citric on the nose. Taste is big peach, citric and generic fruit - deliciously easy to drink for a gueze. Sadly doesnt stick around on the palate though like other great ones of the style. Despite this, it is a lot of fun to drink. Tasty, refreshing. On tap this one takes off into great times - lemon citrus heaven!

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 Blind tasting off 18 current available Gueuzes. Shared with Mathieu87.
bottle 75cl Cantillon Cuvée des Champions. 
Appearance: nice head.
Nose: wasnt really a geuze to me. More IPA like, lots of hop. But that is all explained by it being dry-hopped!
Taste: hops, fruity, dry hopping is done nicely in this one. But I wouldnt place it next to a regular geuze.

re rate: nice beer in general, drank again and updated the score

Sample at Prohibition Pig, hazy orange pour with light head and alright lacing. Notes of sour lemon, wood, funk, grassy herbs, with a light sour finish similiar to other Cantillons. Interesting beer with all the grassy wooden hops flavors mixed in with the always nice Canty butt funk. Very interesting brew from the Belgian brewer.

Clear orange golden colour, firm white head. Floral aroma, citrus, lemon peel, lime juice, funk, light rubber, some horseblanket and lactic acid. Light sour flavour, lemon juice, fresh lactic acid touch. Sour finish, citrus, lemon juice and malts.
Lovely.
(From 75cL bottle @ home. As Cuvée st-Gilloise, 2011.)

Aroma of sherbet and sour cherries. Flavour is so sour it draws your cheeks in. Sweet on the tip of the tongue, bitter and sour on the middle, sour and impossibly dry in the finish. Perfect example of the style. I bet it would age well

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) pours a hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of apricot, citrus fruits and medium funk, with a hint of old cheese, tobacco and cherries. flavour is mostly spicy funk and lemons, with a hint of herbal hops in the light-bitter minerally finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

75cl bottle, from Geers or Cantillon directly, cant remember. Labeled "Cuvée Saint-Gilloise". Poured in classic "Ginder Ale" glass. Pours dusty orange, minimal firm head. Sour nose, dusty attic, grassy manure, green apples and sour candy. Keep trying to smell the hops but cant find any in there. Aroma is lipsmacking Cantillon tartness and funk. Very astringent, but Im not the most seasoned geuze drinker. Obviously mostly sour, but there are worse out there. Palate is good, quenching, dry but not puckering. Would like to taste a more thoroughly dryhopped version.

A bottle, the date of which I did not take down, presumably fresh when I picked it up at a shop in Brussels this June, so one of the Cuvée Saint-Gilloise bottling.
Pours a golden color, a bit hazy with a nice well retained, but small head. 

The aroma is grassy, very grassy... and lemony as well. The beer has a nice deep earthy funkiness, some very fresh cut oak character and a bunch of green peppercorn character. 

The flavor is again very grassy, and very enjoyably sour.... however tending to the low end of sourness for Cantillon. This is as bitter and herbal as any gueuze Ive ever tasted. The hops really do a number on this beer, making it a unique and remarkable Gueuze.

2011 cork date. Split two ways. Consumed on 1-11-13, reviewed from notes. 

A: Clear copper with a foaming white head. Serene inside of the glass. 

N: Delicious. Musty hops, lemon zest, and attic spaces. Oak holds down the fort with some black peppercorns and graininess. Hints of grapefruit and pineapple.

T: Lemons, straw filled barn stalls, pineapple, horse blanket, oats, and wood. Theres a very balanced sourness here and some excellent funk. Tart without being grotesquely sour. 

M: Perfect. Like drinking a pilsner it goes down so smoothly. 

O: Accomplished beer and one of my favorites in the Cantillon pantheon. The hops and the lambic work for me.
As Cuvée Saint-Gilloise, on tap. Poured a cloudy orange, aroma is muted apple and spice. Medium body, quite restrained for the style.

drank @ cantillon. bottled minutes ago ( no, realy) so had no time to get carbonated yet ( this botteling isnt for sale in weeks i supose) . ill rate it ass it is, and re-rate when i have an old/fresh one :p 
this ones realy hoppy on the smell. taste is hoppy, not bitter nor sweet, just .. hoppy.. no sourness as well , but thazt will come when it developes i supose :) 
still reazly nivce though !

750ml bottle, 2012 vintage, purchased at Whole Foods Milwaukee, split with my wife.  Pours an orange amber color with a white head.  Aroma is funky, sour, a little grassy.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is lightly sour, with some sweetness, some familiar Cantillon funk, a little grassy hops, with a light bitter finish.  This is a really interesting and tasty beer.  I understand why some might not consider it a true Gueuze, but it is tasty.

Bottle from etre gourmet. 2012.

Good taste. Not that much sourness. Alot of green apples some bitterness. Quite smooth mouthfeel. Will probably be great with some years in the cellar.

As Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. 2012 bottle. Rose gold with a white head that fades to a coat. Wheaty and funky aroma with lemon, almonds, light spices. Creamy to lassi mouthfeel with quite high carbonation. Taste is quite grainy with wet hay, apricots and their stones, old oranges. Some bitterness under sourness thats brooding rather than sharp.  Not as deep as some other Cantillon beers Ive had, but cheerful and casual is absolutely fine.

0.75 bottle as Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Yellow, murky. Nose has wonderful brett barnyard, hay, wheat. A bit of old hops in there as well. Body is acidic, but well balanced. A bit of citrus. Straw. Compared to the blended lambics, geuzes, Ive had, this is more raw on the hay. Perhaps missing the older components. Mouth drying, palate cleansing.

Bottle at home (from the brewery - labelled as Cuvee Saint Gilloise) 09/12/12.
Pours to an obscured apricot/mandarin colour with no head.
Nose comprises light orange tones, sour fruit, touch of wood, light funk, clean and light.
Tastes of diluted oranges, touch of peach, candi sugars, light wood.
Medium bodied, very light carbonation almost still, moderately tarte finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Thanks Søren! Pours hazy straw yellow. Small white head. Aroma: loads of wood, saw dust, wet wood, funk, light sulfur, dandelion, a bit farty, musty, Brett, light acidic notes. A bit mellow, quite balanced . Taste: follows nose. nice and tart. Very balanced, the dry hop is quite difficult to obtain. Dry lemon, apple cider vinegar,  very woody, musty and a little bit of funk.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2013 A ncie little geuze here. It has aged nicely as this is a chamions bottle, obvoiusly there is no hoppiness to speak of in this one desite the dryhopping.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015 Bottle. Golden. Nose is lemon, funk, hay, hops, floral. Taste is tart lemon and bitter lemon pulp, floral, funk, and bittering hops.

Bottle from Redlight Redlight. Nose is extreme barnyard funk, with a touch of lemon, and dirt. Very tart and potent aroma. Pour is hazy yellow with some white bubbles for a head. Taste is pretty similar with a strongly overpowering funk, acid, light citrus, barnyard taste. Cool stuff but I like the more fruity lambics.

Bottle at Redlight. Slightly hazy golden pour with a small white bubbly head. aroma of funky yeast, lemon peels and a good amount of spicy and citrus hop character. Very smoothed out complex flavor with sweet pils malts, lemon peels, yeast funk and spicy floral hops. Refined funky tart ending. Great beer.

Pours a pale gold with no head. Aroma of funk, oak and citric acid. Taste is funky and tart. Very light and refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml. bottle from Beer Rev. It pours a golden yellow color with a massive white frothy head that is slow to recede. The aroma is very very nice with strong notes of lemon, oak and some wet hay funk. Very bright and inviting. The flavor has lots of lemon, tart orange, citrus peel, hay funk, leather and light hints of oak. Extremely sour, but pleasantly so. No acetic acid, just pure tart, fruity, funky goodness. Perfectly balanced. Probably my favorite Cantillon thus far.

Pours a  light golden color with a finger of fizzy foam. Aromas are earthy hops, citrus, dank funk and tart lemon. On the palate its balances bitter in tart perfectly with nice grapefruit, lemon and pine filling out the palate with a moderately sour kick and a nice dry finish.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours cloudy yellow to light orange with some sediment and white head that went down quickly. Aroma is grapefruit, lambic basement, hops. Flavor very similar, with sour tones more pronounced, but bitterness and hops still very present. I was surprised how much hops are actually present in the aroma and flavor. Very interesting beer.

750 Malt bottle shared by b3shine.   Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized off white head.  The aroma is tart and seemingly dry, withcitrus, herbal and funk.  The flavor is tart citrus and perhaps very light white grapes.  Dry herbal notes with wood intermingle with a funk that grew with each taste.  With everything going on, this remained very drinkable.

Pours a clear and amber beer with a white head. The aroma is hops with pine, grapefruit and lemon. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is bitterness. Overall a really good beer with a really good hops profile.

Bottle. Clear golden with a short lived fizzy white head. Sour green apple and wild yeast aroma with floral vanilla and oak notes. Tastes of lemon followed by green apple transitioning into buttery caramel vanilla and oak and finishing with sweet apple and grape flavors. Rich velvety and mildly bright palate.

My bottle says Cuvée Saint-Gilloise on it.  Absolutely delicious. Smells great, puckers my palate and I want more.  Like right now.  Nearly a straight lambic taste with a little dry bitterness at the end, presumably from the late hop addition.  I have another bottle that I want to let sit, but its gonna be tough to pull that off now that Ive cracked the seal on this one.

75CL bottle acquired in Gent Belgium. Paid around 10 Euro. Bottled November of 2011. Enjoyed in a white wine glass at 60 Degrees F.

A - No cork pop on this one. Slight carbonation on the pour producing a single finger head of off white colors but faded quickly. Bright and slightly cloudy orange appearance.

S - The scent is like many other gueuze. Also some notes of pepper spice and oak. 

T - The taste is VERY unique. Less hoppy than expected but this isnt a fresh bottle. Still, the hop bitterness is apparent and contains notes of pine, peppers and citrus. The finish is very much a gueuze but with more lemon citrus and honey than others. Its a very bright and sweet beer throughout.

M - Light-Medium body, light and effervescent mouth feel. 

O - Im very pleased with this beer. The hops certainly make a  big difference and its one Ill have to drink again when I get a fresher bottle.

Sent to me from my good friend from Alberta, none other then Kyle, You rock brotha! Cantillon can do no wrong IMO. Everything you want is there: the sour flavor, the funk and the tartness. They pride themselves on being very consistent and this one is a great example. Hopefully Ill be able to try this again in the future. Outstanding and one Im really glad I got to try.

Bottle, fresh 2012 batch, 10/20/2012.  Pours cloudy apricot color, medium fluffy head fades to nice glaze on the surface, fine bubbled lacing. Aroma is juicy lemon, white grapes and grapefruit, mild tart edge, lemony grassy hop character with nice dose of barnyard. Taste more tart than the nose, lemon and grapefruit zest with sweet malts, hay, and earthy funk, wood. Base lambic here is mighty tasty. Moderate carbonation this young gives a somewhat thicker palate which is lovely. Great.

February 11, 2012 - with JoeMcPhee, blankboy, jercraigs & mabel. 750ml green bottle c/o blankboy (as Cuveé Saint Gilloise).  Fairly hazy gold with an average lasting rocky off-white head, some light lacing.  Quite different aroma - grape skins, lactose, sweaty feet, some lemon and sweet malt.  Taste follows, more lemon and way more funk, which really builds.  Average body, good lively mouthfeel, a long dry sour finish without a lot of alcohol presence - nice one.

Hazy yellow-orange with a small head. Aroma is moderate barnyard, crisp citrus (lemon +), tart/sourness with slight notes of wood and hops. Flavor of fresh citrus, sour/tartness, fruitiness, lactic acid, wood and slight hops. Dry finish. Medium to full body. Refreshing. A very good Geuze!
nice bottle at akkurat, vintage 2009 a nice geuze noting special just that its great!

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear golden color with an large frothy white head that was lasting with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour, floral hop, yeast aroma. Medium to full body with a dry texture with soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour flavor with a medium sour finish of moderated to long duration. This is a standout for style beer.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - need to re-rate bottle in basement (reminder)
Bottle 75 cl. Pours golden in colour with a white head. The nose is citrus and barnyard with some sourness. Also some wood and hops. Flavour quite sour and with some lemon and herbs as well.

750ML vtg 2011.  Pours a murky amber.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  A mix of citrus flavors coupled with a some sweetness, and some oaky, yeasty funk.  The hop presence is light but evident and gives this both a unique mouthfeell and taste.  The sour is only moderate on this and therefore lends to a very refreshing, quaffable beverage.

bottle share at hill farmstead. almost clear pale golden with a small white cap, some retention. soft funk and barnyard, some sweetness - lactic feeling, medium oxidation and hallertau, light to medium body, dry moderately acidic finish. enjoyed this one!

(St-Gilloise avril 2012, dry hop hallertau): En la respirant jai limpression de me retrouver à la chasse aux ouaouarons en plein marécage dherbes hautes, ça sent la vase et la terre humide. Le goût est assez surprenant, jai limpression de boire le jus dolives vertes marinés, très végétal et très peu fruité. Je lavais choisi pour accompagner des sushis, une meilleure décision en théorie quen pratique.

Opened for Sour Day 2012. Picked this up recently at Binnys, 2011 vintage. Poured into a Duvel tulip. Saint Gilloise pours a cloudy orange in color with about a half finger worth of tight white head. Nose is exceptional, you can definitely detect a good hop presence from the dry hopping, there is also lambic, some urine, and must. Flavor is less focused on the hops and more on the lemon. The hops are more in the background with some moderate funk. Light mouthfeel, light carbonation, heavy lactic acidity, and a long finish. Great beer that is a nice change of pace for Cantillon. I really like the hop character that St. Gilloise and Cuvée des Champions have, its a nice compliment to the lambic. Still prefer Cuvée des Champions more than St. Gilloise, but both are awesome.

18/06/2011 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata densa, torbida, mielosa, con discreta schiuma biancastra, poco persistente. Al naso è intensa e pungente, si percepiscono nette note agrumate (limone, pompelmo), sentori di stalla, cantina. In bocca è moderatamente acida, fortemente citrica, lunghissima e astringente. Corpo medio, carbonazione buona. Straordinaria Gueuze di Cantillon!

Bouteille: Deep golden, hazy, small - but stable - white frothy head, typical Gueuze aromas (malic acid, vinegar, cellary aromas and so on) with a distinctive and almost fresh herbal hop-bouquet; moderate to solid sour flavour with a little sweetness (!), medium to full bodied; fresh hops and tart sour fruits in the finish. Oh, yeah...

questa cuvee invecchiata 2 anni in botte è una vera delizia per gli amanti del genere. lacido si sposa benissimo con lamaro del luppolo herteaux. una vera sorpresa in bocca che aiuta a rinfrescare la giornata. una vera special edition

Bottle @ Cantillon. Pours hazy gold with a small white head. The nose is sweet floral grassy meadow, wild herbs and hints of sweet honey and sugar. The taste is mellow tart lemon cake with indescribable floral accents. Light dry goats cheese. Light body, soft carbonation. Very drinkable and refreshing. Another winner from Cantillon.

Cuvée des Champions. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is acidic, light basement, fruity and light grapefruit. Flaovur is acidic, light oxidiced, grapefruit and light leather. Over the top. 7-3-6-3-13-3.2

Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is ligh acidic, pine, grass, grapefruit and tartness. Flavour is acidic, tart, leather, grass, pine and leather.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with an effervescent white head. Nose is tart, citrus, tangy. Taste is very mellow, with lemon, puckery citrus, and acid. Lip licking tart. Nice.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bottle shared by the one they call blackipa.  Pours a hazed pumpkin color, sports frothy spotty head.  Smell is ok, I suppose...its tame but not faint...maybe a little cheese character, a little grape notes here and there, nothing mind bending.  Flavors bring it up a step, with surpirsingly punch of acid that the nose would convince you wasnt going to be there...but its still not overly complex...but then again, it drink pretty good nonetheless...but I feel Im wanting it to take on a funkiness that it just refuses to take on...fairly straight forward.Earlier Rating: 8/23/2005 Total Score: 3.7Hazed orange, big bubbled halo.  Cheesy aroma with matchtick and sulfur and must in the nose?  or is that coming from the grill?  Damn it.  Flavors are too damn tame and uncomplex..though I suppose its a clean beer.  Gueuzes are boring me..I need fruit lambics to be happy these days..or maybe unblended lambics.

Pours a hazy orange with a head that disappears quite quickly. Aromas of oak, funk, tartness. Taste is light citrus, tart fruit, some light funk. Not as funky as I was hoping for. Finish is quick and dry. Average carbonation. Decent.

Slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Funky Cantillon aroma with grapefruit notes, and lots of herbal and grassy hops. Dry and tart flavour with some citrus notes, and herbal and grassy hop flavour. Really refreshing, with very prominent dry hoppingEarlier Rating: 6/19/2009 Total Score: 3.7As Cuvee 1904 at Bier Circus Cloudy orange with a lasting white head. Aroma has some cellar, funk, grapefruit, typical Cantillon. Tart with lots of grapefruit peel-type astringency, lots of wood in the finish.

75 cl bottle to oversized snifter (shared with the Mrs.; 2011 vintage). Looks good; dark orange and opaque with good carbonation and white lacing. Smells interesting; funky AND hoppy. Tastes good; funky with lots of grapefruit and citrus zest flavor, with hop notes present. Nice on the palate. Not my favorite Cantillon, but an interesting spin on things, and still damn good beer!

Bottle @ In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst. Vintage 2010. Hazy golden with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 220712Earlier Rating: 7/25/2011 Total Score: 4Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet and moderate sour - vinegar. Flavor is medium sweet, moderate sour and rather acidic. Bone dry and rather acidic finish. 090711

On tap @ Mikkeller. Hazy orange with a finger of white head. Aroma is very funky and bretty - huge leather and barnyard, but also huge fruity brett profile with grapefruit and tart green apples and white grapes. Lots of zesty citrus notes and some tropical notes, a bit lile tutti frutti bubble gum. Some dry oak and tannins along with lactobaccillus notes. Taste has pretty much the same notes, still very fruity for a gueuze. Lots of citrus and grape, a bit of pineapple on top of a considerable tartness from the lactobaccillus. Highly balanced, the sweet fruits contra tart lacto come together near perfectly, a bit remeniscent of Girardin Black Label. Very very good.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2012 75cl bottle, Kaisla 26.7 2012 as my 1800:th rating. Poured pale yellow, thin lacing white head. Barnyard, sourish, typical Cantillon aroma. Flavor is weaker, very dry, high carbonation, grapes, hops. Thin. Small disappointment. Bottled 2010.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head. The aroma is fruity and acidic with notes of dry hops. The flavour is quilte fruity and hoppy with a tart and acidic kick. Very nice and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 2/15/2009 Total Score: 3.8Bottle at Plan B. Cloudy golden body with a white bubbly head. Dry acidic aroma with citrus notes, dust and basement. Flavour is strong acidic with some grapefruit and chlorine. Long citric tart acidic finish. Bubbly mouthfeel.
Pours orange. Nose is tart with lactic acid lemons and sweet cheese. Flavor is tart lactic and mild acetic notes. Funk and earthy basement flavors. Slightly musty. Lovely mouthfeel. really nice.

October 2010 bottle.  early pout is hazed gold with your typical soft and fine white head.  first scent has a mild green cork note with assertive hop pungency and heavily musty mineral / gravel / concrete mix yeast.  touches of wet paint show up as well.  medium-light body with high acid and heavy yogurt / lactic sourness front to back.  more green mold and wet paint, theres definitely some effect of cork and oxidation in this one, Im sad to say. as it warms the approach becomes more doughy and lactic while the acidity and bitterness in the finish remains unchanged.   molded cereal grains begin to go late, and sourness becomes quieted by neutralizing yeast.  overall an interesting one to compare to the base geuze but Im sad to say I dont think this bottle is in the best of shape.Earlier Rating: 7/13/2005 Total Score: 4.2Cuvée des Champions
Murky yellow with a typical Cantillon filmy white head, glowing color just entices the tongue... you know whats coming, palate killer city.  First taste is extremely sour and punchy, with the flavor of acidic roasty corn, with burlap and wood in the nose - to put it frankly: awesome.  Subtly smooth texture, with some scorching acid and tart crackers on the back of the tongue, bread and other farmhouse qualities.  A really wonderful gueuze, and a highlight of the RBSG tasting for me.


Cuvée du 89 - Bier Circus, Brussels, May 2006.  This is the version of Cuvée des Champions which is dryhopped with a different hop than normal.  It is made for the Bier Circus, and they offered both 75cl and 37.5cl bottles.  Slightly murky, bubbles rise up to a medium-to-small sized head.  Strong, raw, almost "rancid" nose, very rough and raw on the olfactory senses... lovely.  Very fresh and puckery sour flavor up front, syrupy even (slightly).  Intensely sour, as is common with Cantillon, has a very young quality to it, you can still taste the raw ingredients... but definitely you can tell that this is not a normal gueuze blend.


2003-2004 bottle opened in May 2009.  Weird almond and cork scented nose.  Strange oiliness to the body, slimy and filmy almost.  Seems darker than I remember.  Still good but seems like this bottle or vintage may have lost something.

2011 decanted bottle to wine glass
Sweet apple and grape aroma. Pale yellow with slight cloudiness. Tastes like lemon.

750 bottle at Chez Moeder Lambic. Pours cloudy golden with a very attractive white head and a floral fruity aroma. There is a delicate fruit flavor with a champagne-like mouthfeel. Leaves fresh fruit on the palate. The gueuze base is excellent.Earlier Rating: 10/17/2008 Total Score: 3.8This light gold beer poured with a miniscule off-white head and  a sour fruity aroma. The flavor is considerably more sour and citrusy than I expected since candi sugar was added for the refermentation. However, this is a fine gueuze that tastes suthentic even though it is unblended.,

Everytime I get a new Cantillon an excitement seems to rush through me.  Ive had this bottle for over 5 years, it seems like I just never got around to opening it.  Tonight is the night.  Love the golden yellow colour to this, good white head to it as well.  Light hops in the aroma, lots of funk, lemons, brett and a wonderful basement must.  The flavour is just amazing, lots of must and highly acidic.  Cantillon have great balance between hops, sourness and drinkability.  Fantastic stuff all round, another in the line of amazing lambics produced at Cantillon.

750ml bottle obtained in a trade with ClarkVV.
Opened on September 12, 2010.
No date but have had the bottle since June 4, 2005.

Thanks to ahalloin for sharing this at a tasting!

A: Straw yellow with a smallish cloudy head that fades after a few moments and leaves little lacing in its wake

S: Woot! Hay, heaven, straw, heaven, tart citrus fruit, heaven, etc.

T: Mildly acidic (for a gueuze, that is), pleasant warming sensation that surprised me. Im tasting a lot of things in this complex and anticipated brew. Lemon zest and tart green apples are at the forefront. The sourness is so inviting and delicious. Go Cantillon - the champions of lambics and gueuzes!

M: warm finish, puckering, carbonation level is very well done

D: a subtle vinegar finish diminishes the drinkability factor slightly. In spite of that, I could sip this all day and night. I cant wait to get some more of this. What a treat.Earlier Rating: 6/29/2012 Total Score: 4On draft at Churchkey in D.C. Served side by side with Fou Fonne. Review from notes.

This beer appears a hazy orange, with a little head that fades rather quickly. The beer smells spicy, funky, and noticeably more subtly sour than I expected from a Cantillon. Of course, I did drink this side by side with Fou Fonne, which was incredibly tart. I found this to be an enjoyable beer, but it lacked the depth and/or complexity that Cantillon beers usually have in spades. This was a plain, decent offering from a brewery that I hold in the highest esteem.

Pouring at The Festival in Worcester.  Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head.  Sweet funk, big musk and brett.  Lots of funk right away.  Acid is very gentle, and not very prominent.  Big funky brett, long and cheesy.  Beautiful.Earlier Rating: 8/31/2009 Total Score: 3.9Tap at the Where the Wild Beers are event.  Pours a hazy golden amber with a medium thick creamy white head.  Loads of brett, dry musky attic.  Just on the thin side of medium, light sweetness, good funk and dry tart brett.  Finishes with a nice soft bitterness.  Yummy

Bottle with Andrew at The Festival in MA. Pours a amber hazed, amber body with thin carbonated lacing. Aroma is funk, tart fruit and sour notes. Mouthfeel is tart, slightly puckering with notes of funky, tart fruit, musk, dust, delicious.Earlier Rating: 7/18/2010 Total Score: 4.1Draft at Teresas with pat. Bottle at festival, Worcester, MA. Golden pour, lots of lemon citrus, funk, barnyard. Very tart bite. Puckeringly sour. Real good

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Bottle:
Medium pretty vast off white head on top of a hazy amber colored beer.
Smelll cheese, sour, barnyard, wood, yeast bacteria, manure, millet.
Taste sour, wild yeast, fruity hops, yoghurt sour, yeast bacteria, sour grains, barnyard, sparkling, lemon, tart, hint of wood and a hint of dried soury fruit notes, herby grass and something like grainy hay ish corny wheaty millet sour taste.
Aftertaste is also very nice: yoghurt sour with some yeasty fruity and old malty farm ish touches.

text:
Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy golden with almost no head (would be white).
Aroma is of citrus, fruits, sourness, barnyard, bretts. Taste is of sourness, lactic acid, citrus, barnyard, bretts. Good body, refreshing, not too heavy on the sourness. A very good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Had it several times from bottles (750 ml) and draft fresh and with a few years on it. 

Appearance: Hazy golden/orange with a small fully lasting white head and little lacing.  

Aroma: Lemon/citric presence are dominant, but well balanced by the floral hops. Theres also plenty of barnyard as well as hay, oak and brettanomyces.  

Taste: Quite lemony/citric here too. Moderately sour. The floral presence is just enough to create a good balance. Theres also oak, barnyard, hay, brettanomyces as well as light bitterness.

Palate: Light to medium body. Soft/moderate carbonation. A tad oaky mouthfeel. Mild lingering lemony and floral finish.  

Overall: The lemony character of the Cantillon lambic is well balanced by the hops in this one. Even when fresh, the hops are never overpowering. I also prefer this one to the Gueuze bio even with a few years on it. The hops gives a little more depth to this gueuze. Easy drinking despite, like the Cantillon Gueuze bio, being a bit less smooth than Drie Fonteinen or Oud Beersel.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2013 Bottle. Citrus aromas blended with cat piss. Taste sauer like vinegar. Still like. Its called sadomasochismen. Mash-up. Fresh. Slight haze yellow. Citrus. Tart oaky.

In bottle at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a dark golden colour with a fair white head. Aroma of minty dry hops, lemon and oak. Similar flavours and nicely tart with a dry finish. Moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Quite different with the dry hop addition.

On draft pour.  Amberish color with little to no head.  Tart barnyard funk.  Dry.  Well rounded.Earlier Rating: 8/11/2011 Total Score: 4750 bottle.  Murky yellow color with a white head.  A nice funky sour taste.  Not overwhelming.  Just right.

750ml, bottled October 04, 2010.  I was surprised to find that at 1.5 years, and despite what I deem to be proper cellaring, the cork on this puppy was half way saturated and almost too soft to pull.  Still, it came out clean.  The pour yields a very slightly hazy, glowing, golden-tangerine amber body.  Neverending streams of fine bubbles feed a fuller than usual (for Cantillon) head of lasting, eggshell tinted foam.  Short, rounded flares and spots of lace slowly meander back towards the body.As expected, the nose is drop dead gorgeous.  Nobody captures that musty-sharp apricot perfume note like Cantillon, and this one is no exception.  The Hallertau hops lend a perfectly restrained, grassy, hay-like bite.  Of course, theres the requisite buggy, woody farmhouse funk, but it too seems relatively soft thanks to fruity and cereal-like malts.  Its incredibly saison-like, and nods to a few exceptional American beers that Ive had lately, most notably Upright Fantasia....only better.  I guess the nod really goes the other way then, doesnt it?The flavor follows suit, tart and sharp, mouth-puckering at times, but also reasonably subdued thanks to the leftover malty sugars.  Concentrated apricot sour is the most prominent element, followed by hints of lemon and dried pineapple (a brettanomyces signature).  German hops again add just the right amount of grassy, leafy, bitter bite. Damn tasty.The palate is a little bit creamier and heftier than most gueuze, but still exceptionally dry, with crisp, prickly carbonation.  It is exceptionally drinkable.  Overall, Cuvée Saint-Gilloise falls just a bit short of its masterful cousin, Cuvée des Champions, but Im really splitting hairs here.Lately, in my mind, Hill Farmstead has been in hot pursuit of the title "Worlds Best Brewery."  Every now and then you need to sample the masters to remind yourself what it is that the young guns are striving for.Earlier Rating: 4/3/2008 Total Score: 4.510/4/9/4/18 = 4.5.  Regular version.  Courtesy mgumby10.  Pours a hazy tangerine yellow color with a small, fizzy, bubbly white head.  Jagged columns of lacing protrude from the body like solar flares do from the sun.  First sniff.....WHOA!  This smells fantastic!  Strong notes of sour apricots and nectarines, two of my favorite fruits, explode into the nose.  Fresh squeezed grapefruit, mild farmhouse funk, and lightly sweet candy sugar complete the aroma.  The first sip stands behind the promise that the nose makes.....this thing tastes great.  Funky as hell, sour, tart apricots and nectarines dominate again.  Grapefruit is present again, playing more of a background role.  Mouth puckering, but not as extreme as some other Cantillons.  Balanced perfectly for my palate.  Moderate carbonation levels match the dry, medium body perfectly.  This is a mind-blowing beer.  Second only to Kaggen (amongst dozens of incredible beers) at the infamous Merritt Island Throwdown, March 2008.8/4/9/5/17 = 4.3.  Cantillon cuvee du van 89.  4 years old as of summer 2009.  Exclusive 375ml for Le Bier Circus in Brussels.  Im told this is the Cuvée des Champions with a different dry hop billing.  Pours a hazy, medium golden-amber hue with fine streams of micro-bubbles that effervesce towards the surface, pooling into a thin but steadfast head of pure white foam that lasts for the duration.  Just a few spots of sticky lace remain behind.  The aroma is beautiful, steeped with sour apricot and peach notes amidst citric acidity and strong, woody oak notes.  The requisite horseblanket funk is there, though the residual lemony grassiness from the dry hopping cuts through it well. Flavors are equally delicious, strikingly sour with notes of lemon, apricot, peach, and nectarine. Though not the focus, the grassy hops lend just a bit of a resinous bite that really works. Mostly dry, tart, crisp and slightly puckering, with a nice and subtle hop finish.  Fantastic brew.  Cantillon rules!

Bottle into a Cantillon tumbler.  Pours a nice, clear golden color with a slightly-foamy white head.  Pretty good retention and a bit of lacing.  The nose has a nice faint hop character from a fairly-fresh better.  Barnyard and a bit of hay in the background along with a touch of lemon zest.  Flavor is nice and acidic with a citric bite alongside some earth and funk.  Body is light and crisp with a nice acidic dryness to the finish.  Fantastic beer.Earlier Rating: 12/1/2010 Total Score: 4.1Bottle shared by bmanning at a recent tasting along with Azurelimits, amyliz4, and hhanson.

A: Pours a bright gold with a nice single-finger or so bone-white head. 

S: Nice touch of hops in this one, which really stands out, especially as earlier in the night I had said Id like to a sour with some dry hops coming into play. This worked out really well in the nose alongside sourness, some funk, and general earthy characteristics.

T: Funk, wheat dryness, citrus, lactic sourness, a bit of acetic acid, and some hoppy characteristics, mostly of the dry, floral variety.

M: Very nice all-around sourness in addition to some nice dryness. Good carbonation. As always with Cantillon, nothing really to complain about.

D: Very nice. After this Id love to try a fruitless wild ale, gueuze, etc. that had been freshly dry-hopped with something like Amarillo.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-03-2010

Another beauty by deftim13 shared at the Mikes. Hazy light orange amber with tiny head to scant lace. Warm sweet tart on the nose. Smooth. Big round fruity with just a bit of tartness. Opposite of sharp and dry. Round and wet in mouth. Tartness increases with warmth. Very little carbonation. Long lingering tart apple back. Nice.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Draft at 33, 9/20/2010: When Cantillon kegs are popping up around St. Louis, I am a happy man. Pours a cloudy dull gold color with a massive, frothy white head. Aroma of lemon citrus, bready malts, wood, herbal and grassy notes, and a nice light funk character. Flavor of lemon-lime citrus, herbs, wood, dust, bready malts- mostly just a beatifully drinkable tart flavor that made me drink this way too quickly to fully appreciate the complexity. That counts for the aroma, too. Finishes dry. Medium-bodied, with a tart mouthfeel and average carbonation. More of this, please. Re-Rate: 4/30/12. 750 ml bottle shared by lushawn- thanks a lot, Shawn! Bottle dated 10/10. Pours a hazy gold color with a big eggshell white head. Funky, earthy, corky, woody, and acidic. Lemony citrus, with some grass and dairy notes. High carbonation. Not my favorite from these guys, but yet another solid, complex gueuze. (Rating is an average of the 4.2 and 3.8 I gave to the versions of the CdC and St. G I tried, respectively). Another rerate from Zwanze Day 2013 at Holy Grale in Louisville. Back up to 4.2. Best Cantillon beer I had all day.

Bottle.    Notes of musty old cellar,  bright lemon and acidic yogurt sourness,   soft leather.   Dry.  Clean.  Nice balance.  Real nice.Earlier Rating: 10/1/2009 Total Score: 4.42003-2004 Bottle consumed 10/1/09. from Hopdog.  Thanks!!   pours a deep orangish brown with a two finger white fluffy head.   Aroma is subtle notes of  lemon, bread and butter, wood, perfume, cereal, grass, herbs,  mold, leather and horse blanket.  Flavor is very pleasant lemony tartness, with some lemongrass, lime, etc.  Really nice dry finish.

Quite herbal and yeasty along with light hops, light spices, a hint of tartness and some sugary sweetness. Flavour is yeasty and herbal along with spices and citrus fruit. Medium bodied. Simply fantastic!

Green bottle, 75 cl, bottled on November 2 2011, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured March 31 2012; eye: copper, clear, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: woody, Brettanomyces yeast, sourness, acidity, light candied sugar; mouth: woody, Brettanomyces yeast, sourness, acidity, light candied sugar, orange, finale in orange with sour presence, medium body, below-average carbonation ; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 75 cl, embouteillée le 2 novembre 2011, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 31 mars 2012; il : cuivrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : boisé, levure Brettanomyces, aigreur, acidité, léger sucre candi; bouche : boisé, levure Brettanomyces, aigreur, acidité, léger sucre candi, orange, finale en orange avec présence aigre, corps moyen, carbonatation sous la moyenne; en résumé : correct

330 ml bottle bought @ Bierkompass.de and shared with Marsiblursi. Pours tiny hazy golden with a big frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some lacing on the glass. Smell is sour and tiny sweet with wood, pine, unripe mango, leather, wet hay, barnyard, lemon juice, apples, red berries, pineapple, brett and horse blanket. Taste is sour and tiny floral with apples, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, red currants, elder berries, rhubarb, raspberries, wild strawberries, grass, allspice, leather and horse blanket. Mouthfeel is silky, very balanced and medium bodied. Finish i tart with red currants, lemon juice, grass, grapefruit juice and orange peal.

(Bottle) Pours hazy orange witha white head. He aroma holds boat loads of horse blanket, pine soap, peppery lemon/lime/grapefruit, damp basement, wet earth, juniper, clove, bayleaf, allspice, tart yellow fruits/pineapples/mango, unripe berries, red betrodd, crackers and hints of smoked meat/fish. The flavour near dry, medium svidit and tiny bitter. Lots of citrus, balanced lacto, fairly subtle brett, touch of hops, hints of wood and cracker-like malt. Spicy and fruity. The mouthfeel is soft and round with a medium carbonation. Woodsy and citric finish. Near medium bodied.

reviewed 09-18-2010. vintage 2008. pours a hazy dirty yellow and orange with a quick forming inch plus head that quickly gave way leaving a nice layer of retention. massive lemon up front with nice subtle sourness mixed with oak and orange. more citrus in the taste. lots of lemon with hints of lime and orange. a sharp zest through out the finish. light oak malts creep out from behind. light to moderate carbonation, light body. tons of flavor, nothing too overpowering, and quite refreshing. i am now going to hunt down some more of these. amazing.
750ml Bottle - Gold/amber with a haze. Dried peach and must in the aroma. Tangy and tart taste with peach, malt and sour lemon.

Bottle. (thanks SirLimpsalot)

Hazy deep golden with a small short lasting head. Nice tart aroma with citrus, yeast and some fruit. Dry and tart taste. Really refreshing and drinkable. Not the best one from Cantillon but very enjoyable.

Earlier Rating: 7/2/2010 Total Score: 4On tap at Akkurat in July 2010. 

Hazy orange with a very small white head. Not extremely sour,  very drink  friendly with a lot of grapefruit in the aroma and taste. Dry with taste of oak in the finish.

From notes.  First reviewed 9/26/2011.  2010 Vintage. Poured from a 750 mL corked and capped bottle into a tulip.

My pour has a cloudy tangerine orange color with a delicate white froth. The head only remains for a minute before fading to a ring and a thin film, but it still leaves a few wisps of lace.

The aroma is full of barnyard funk, horse blanket, and leather. Slightly musty as well. There is some good tart acidity to the nose. Tons of Brett in this one.

The flavor is pleasantly sour, blended, and balanced. Some light grains prelude lemon zest and a little grapefruit sour flavor. Some straw and grassy notes draw out the flavor, and the finish has some musty earthiness. 

This is acidic, with some lactic character. Fairly dry, medium bodied with delicate carbonation. A bit more dry at the finish.

This was one of the first gueuzes that I was able to really get into, and now I think I am an addict of the style.

Rated from file. Consumed May 2011.
Look: Amber-orange with a frothy head that dissipates to a small thin ring.
Smell: Funky! and sour-smelling. Some floral hop character coming out after a little while.
Taste: Deep sour, fruit, probably more pungent than the geuze, with a fair hop bitterness and a mild hop finish
Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied and fine carbonation. Well executed.
Overall: An interesting take on a style Im not intimately familiar with, but the Euro hop profile needs more beef.

Bottle Sample at the 2nd Israeli Sour Tasting. Thanks DSG 2010 bottle. Pours clear yellow to orange with a nice head, aroma of olives, brett, wood and lavender, flavor is sourish with nice bitterness, wood, lemon, zesty, medium to full bodied, great

[2875-20100521] 750mL bottle. Dry dusty citrus yeast aroma with a hint of cardboard. Hazy, light brown orange body with a quick foamy white head. Sour paper citrus yeast flavour. Medium body is quite smooth considering the sourness. Very tasty, quite enjoyable. (7/3/8/3/17) 3.8
(Bottled 29-Jan-2010; c/o Bobsy, w/ him, jerc, Julie)

(c/o blankboy, w/ him, HogTownHarry, jerc, JoeMcPhee)
