750ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye.
Dull orange brew with a frothy white head.  Smells great - oak, barnyard, and citrus.  Flavors of wood, tangerine, apricot - wonderfully tart.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with an average, creamy white head; good retention and spare lacing. Aroma is sour fruit, yeast, cookie malt, spice, and grassy notes. Flavor is average malt, minimal hops, and heavy sour esters; sour, slightly dry finish. Medium body and warmth with high carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Bottle shared at the 2nd Israeli Sour Tasting. As Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise. 2010 bottle. Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of lots of barnyard, some sweaty notes and a bit of hops. Sour flavor with oak, fruits, a bit of sweaty hints and a bone-dry finish, slightly astringent, with a bit of citric notes. Medium-bodied, rounded mouthfeel. 8/4/8/4/17=4.1Earlier Rating: 4/1/2008 Total Score: 4.1(3/11/08) Bottle at Bier Circus in Brussels as Cuvée du 89. Slightly hazy golden with a medium frothy white head. Aroma of barnyard. Citrusy, dry, sour flavor with soft bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied. This is really good. 8/4/8/4/17=4.1

Pale golden pour with a tight white head. The nose is softly lactic and a little bit tart. Lots of bright fresh character. A little bit of citrus (lemon/lime and grapefruit). Bright funk and a little bit of fresh lemon. Delicious stuff. Earlier Rating: 8/19/2006 Total Score: 4.7750 ml bottle.  Deep golden beer that pours perfectly clear.  Light spritzy carbonation.  Aroma is pure cantillon, leathery, barnyardy aroma with some light cologne.  Very vineous nose with a light earthy character.  Lighter acidity than is typical for Cantillon.  Some pear/apricot fruitiness.  In the mouth, the beer is crisp and bracing with soft lactic acidity, cologne and some earthy/spicy hop flavours as well.  Much more restrained than most of their other offerings, but with less acidity the backing complexities are on display for all to see.  Earthy dryness, perfumy hops with a great balance of acid, Brett and earthiness.  Warming brings out even more peachy fruit and the malts are more prominent than in any other lambic Ive had.  First rate stuff.

Cuvee de 89
Bottle shared with random American I met at the bar.  Pale golden beer, creamy head.  Incredible aroma classical Cantillon sourness, grapefruit/lemon and heavy funkiness and acidity.  Apricot and peach with some strong lemony citrus notes.  Fruity and fresh.  The hops appear to have diminished somewhat, but they do play off the typical fruitiness that Cantillon has.  Assertive sourness.
9 4 8 4 17

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2012 2012-02-11. Hazy golden yellow body with a small white head. 3+ Flavour has a good amount of sourness, lightly must, muted lemon seed notes. 7+ Musty aroma, dusty malt, touch of barnyard. Average bodied palate. Relatively simple lambic, but tasty and enjoyable.  7/3/7/3/16 Bottle shared by Blankboy
2010-05-22. Lightly hazy golden yellow body with a modest white head. Aroma has notes of dandelion, light lemon, light musty character. 7+ Flavour is less intensely sour than expected from a Cantillon product, to its benefit in my opinion. Light lemon and funk, mild cereal grain undertones. Not super complex, but far more drinkable than many lambics. 7+ Smooth average plus palate is lightly carbonated. Very nice. 7/3/8/3/16  Labeled Saint-Gilloise, Bottled 29 January 2010, shared by Bobsy
Copper-orange, clear, persistent off-white head.  Aroma:  lightly sweet, grainy malt with dry, earthy funk.  Flavor:  grainy malt, moderately tart, dusty, hint of lemon.

Pour is a transparent golden peach with a very loose small bubbled white head.  The nose has a lightly dusty funk, cob web, hint of sea salt and some zesty yeast notes.  There are some golden fruits behind and a strong hp punch of juicy citrus and floral hops.  The taste seems brighter and more balanced.  Very dusty funk, lemon rind and a bit of sour peach.  There is a fair bit of lingering sourness, citrus hops, and an assertive bitterness with just a light touch of heat. Medium body, very active and granular on the palate, high carb and fairly dry.  This is starting to open up in flavor and has an interesting and awesome hop presence and bitterness but not quite balanced and integrated enough to be great.

On draft at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa in Rome.  Pours hazy golden with a big white head.  Nose is sour fruits, dusty leather and a little hops.  Taste is sweet for a hair of a second before giving way to to bitter followed by sour to the finish.  This is still a bit young, a few years will take that bitter away completely.  Mouthfeel is light and soft with an amazing aftertaste.  Outstanding beer.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Rating for Cuvée Saint-Gilloise: 750mL bottle consumed at In De Wildeman on my Amsterdam trip in October 2011. Poured into a wine glass.  The lambic is more buttery and hoppy than I am used to.  This seems to be the case with this series of brews.  Still has plenty of acidity in the flavor.  Its not my fav lambic but still good stuff. 7/4/7/4/15
Earlier Rating: 9/5/2006 Total Score: 4Bottle from Spuyten Duyvil. Pours dark yellow with some lacing.  Cannot see through the beer.  Aroma is very present - high on fruity tartness and sourness but low on the burnt rubber.  Taste is similar.  Effervescent mouthfeel.  Real dry.  I got a real lively fruity feel but without the sweetness, which to me makes this gueze stand apart. 8/3/8/4/16375mL bottle made for and drank at Le Bier Circus. Aroma is very lemony leather with barnyard and sweaty sock that has dried out (in a good way).  Taste is pretty subdued for Cantillon, lemon with low acidity and a tart finish at the end.  A lot more cloudier and murkier color than before.8/4/8/3/17.CdC again but this was bottled on 02-2008 and the brewer broke it out at the brewery tour.  Its an amazingly different beer than previous incarnations. Aroma hits you with HOPS and lots of strong Cantillon citrus.  There is a bit of lactose  or lightly spoiled dairy.  Taste is lower on the acidity but a strong lemon kick with lots of tartness on the back end. Still plenty of hops and a lot of young lambic rubber in here.  A super hoppy lambic, a first.8/4/8/4/17.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
Botella. Hazy nice deep golden orange colour, medium white head, short lasting, lively. Pleasant tart flowery barn aroma. Good mouthfeel. Lovely tart flowery dry flavour with citrus something herby like. Floral tart dry finish. 
Lovely!

Draught at Akkurat cons 2011-12-28 Stockholm
AP: hazy honey colored body, 1 cm high thick stouthy wee bubbly head (lovely poured by the girl in the bar)
AR: tart, yeasty, mango, passion fruit
F: tart, horse blanket, dryness, white grapes, wee bubbly loaded with carbonation, medium bitterness, finish is tart and sweet... ooo and yeah goose berries
Poured into a large snifter.  Aroma is tart lemon and apple with some earthy funk.  Taste is under ripe green apple and an interesting funk taste and a very dry finish.  Really interesting gueze.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2012 Bottle courtesy of glouglouburp. Green apples and big tartness on the nose. This finish is really wants extraordinary here, dry like an ipa.

750ml bottle pours a hazy, burnt orange with some spitty white head.  Nose is nice, soapy, grassy, lemons, light funk.  Flavor is mild grass, tart lemon, horsey, grapefruit.  Medium bodied, tart finish.Earlier Rating: 4/15/2010 Total Score: 4.1Travlr pulled this 750ml bottle out to end the night.  What a treat.  Pours a hazy, straw gold with a frothy white head.  Aroma is spectacular, musty, grassy, horsey, lemon rind, tart and so so guezy.  Flavor is tart, lemons, grass, hay, must, sweet tarts.  Finish is dry and bitter.  We drank a bottle of Isabelle Proximus the same night.  When I tried this, I imagined Tomme, Rob Todd, and Vinnie sitting around a table, drinking this and wanting to brew something similar.  This is greater than the sum of its parts.
Bottle. Light pour, with a pretty generous finger of white foam. Aroma of mellow funk, some pears, lots of hops. Taste is very well balanced sour and bitter. A very good mix of old and new.

bottle, cant recall who shared this but thanks. Pours gold with a white head nose hay juicy fruit vinegar, flavors are grassy lemon
rind, hay funk. real solid.Earlier Rating: 9/3/2007 Total Score: 3.8listed as "Dernere Cuvee du Van 89" at the bier circus, brussels. pours slightly hazed golden white head. nose is funky, lemony, and anti-septic. flavor is very dry, and a bit plan for cantillon, some oak, horse blanket, lemon, and slightly medicinal. mouth feel is fizzy and acidic. yes its crisp and refreshing but its bland and harsh. not one of cantillons better moments. I really think this beer is not Cuvee des Champions because it doesnt taste anyting like it and the bottle i had was brewed for bier circus. ill have to investigate this. 2.8. 

Late June 09, 750ml bottle dated 1/08, pours hazy gold white head. nose of vanilla, oak, funk, white winey. flavors of vinegar, oaky, floral, phenolic, and very dry acidic finish. 3.8.

Lasiin kaatuu oranssinen ja hyvin samea olut valkoisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on happamuutta huokuvaa greippimäistä hedelmäisyyttä. Maku on hapan ja hedelmäinen, hieman makea. Hapan ja kevyt olut, jonka hiilihappoisuus on melko korkea.

Bottle shared by oteyj and craftycarl21.  Pours clear gold with a medium, fizzy white head, medium-short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is grapes, cassis, black walnut, straw and hay malt, barnyard and horse blanket with lactic notes.  Flavor is grapes, cassis, black walnut, light spices, straw malt, paper, acetic and faint vinegar with a dry finish.  Medium-light body, low warmth, high carbonation.Earlier Rating: 12/22/2008 Total Score: 4Bottle.  Pours clear dark yellow with a small, fizzy, white head, mostly diminishing with spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (hay, straw, meal), average hops (herbs, grass), heavy yeast (horse blanket, barnyard, earth, musty) with notes of grape, green apple, and wood.  Light bodied, mineral texture, soft carbonation, and a sour finish.  Long duration, light sweetness, heavy acidity and sourness.

750mL 2009 ed thanks to ryan. Pours a hazy deep peach, glowing, with a smaller white head. Not as rocky or billowing as the Saint Gilloise. Nose is much more subtle than Saint Gilloise with fruity tangerine, mango, pineapple. Getting some of those epic Cantillon tropical geuze notes that I love from 1998 Cantillon Geuze and Cantillon Loerik. Taste is wicked grapefruit in bitterness and acidity, mango, tangerine, lots of Russian River Beatification character. White pepper, long moldy grapefruit finish. Really good. Super sharp and bitter fruit leather palate. Excellent. Pretty much a combo of near superlative Cantillon nose plus Cantillon Iris/Russian River Beatification bitter grapefruit. Just as good as the Saint Gilloise just a better nose and less aggressive hoppiness. Fantastic.Earlier Rating: 12/12/2011 Total Score: 4.4750mL thanks to oteyj. Essentially a more aggressive version of Cantillon Iris with huge effervescence, massive rip your head off white grapefruit and gassy, leafy hops. An unbeatable combo!Pours a hazy light gold with a larger white head. Rocky, impressive retention. Grassy hop nose with muted green bottle skunk. As it decants you get juicy tangerine, citrus fruits, Valencia orange. Taste is super bright, huge grassy and herbal hop smackdown followed by Russian River Beatification and Cantillon Iris like white grapefruit demolition. So incredible! Palate is long, grassy, bitter grapefruit peel and white grapefruit sections. Super dry, long finish. Perfect acid balance. A new favorite for sure.

Bottle shared by oteyj and craftycarl21: pours a translucent bright golden bronze with a stringy-lacing white head.  Has an earthy dry floral hoppy nose with a decent amount of tart citrus. Starts with pretty good fullness and fine carbonation with a dry herbal funky bitterness and tart complexity before a slightly resiny and earthy bitter and tart finish.Earlier Rating: 5/5/2007 Total Score: 403-04 vintage bottle sampled on 3/14/07: Pours a transparent bright copper bronze with a thin, wispy white head.  Dry, funky, horseblanket, earthy, cheesy, musty aroma has some tart notes.  Body starts with a nice, full viscous tart sour earthy funky flavor with an acidic, warming complex cheesy finish.  A good gueuze.

Slightly hazy orange yellow pour with a thin white head.  Good amount of carbonation.  Hoppy aroma with light funk and barnyard.  Moderate amount of sourness with some funky.  Hoppy finish.  Herbal and piny.  Not bad.Earlier Rating: 5/23/2009 Total Score: 3.7Vibrant bubbly orange-yellow pour.  Thin white head.  Funky sour vinegar flavor with lots of earthy notes.  Woody and earthy flavor.  Very sour, though not quite as much as Cantillons regular geuze.  Interesting.

750ml bottle from Belgium 
Appearance: Clear yellow with a big white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Tart fruit and pepper 
Taste: Tart, grainy and citrus  
Very nice and easy drinking

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 2009 Cuvee des Champions bottling shared with another BA at Monks in Philly in June of 2010.
A: Hazy orange-golden body. Large off-white head after each pour into a cantillon lambic glass. Spotty clumps of lacing left on the glass.
S: Truly world class. Nice acidic sour lemons, wheat, straw/hay, barnyard funk, yeast, oak, musty funk, and a little orange. Layers upon layers of funky lambic goodness.
T: Honestly, this was a bit of a let down after the nose... but upon further reflection this was quite delicious. Sour lemons, some lactic tartness, straw, oak and barnyard funk. Not quite the same level of complexity and layered depth as the nose.
M: Medium bodied. Gentle carbonation. Lingering sourness with some tartness in the middle. Refreshing and invigorating.
O: Really enjoyable. kicking myself for not stocking up when I had the chance months ago. if you see this on the shelves buy two. one for you and message me to trade the other.


Cuvee St. Gillouise 2010 vintage, consumed September 2011: 8/4/8/4/16= 4.0
A:  Golden-orange body with a large, bubbly white head.  Just a few streaks of lacing left after each sip. 
S: Bright citric blast up front--a combination of lemon acidity and general citric hoppiness.  A nice marriage between the two.  Mild oak and funk toward the back-end. 
T: Cleaner flavor profile--less funk and earthyness and more citric notes--than older bottles of cuvee des champions.  Part of it is the freshness, but I think part of it is the recent trend of Cantillon lambic becoming a bit sharper and more citric-acidic than before.  
M: Soft acidity, moderate sourness, effervescent but not overbearing carbonation, medium body.
O: Its a nice product, but I certainly prefer the more barnyardy cuvee des champions.
Non-ratable dry-hopped gueuze variants:.
La Derniere Cuvee du 89 : (4/9/8/4/17 - 4.2) Amazingly bright and hoppy after all a fair amount of time in the bottle (2004, opened 2013).

Big thanks to FooFaa aka Dan for opening this one up at Ffej of July IX. No idea of the year.
A - Pours murky amber yellow with a small one finger tall white head leaving light lace down the glass.
S - Smells of wet grassy hops, lemon and other bold citric fruits, dry oak, and the typical wet basement funk. Complex yet simple.
T - This one isnt as sour as some of the other Cantillon beers I have had. Starts off with a nice bright citric kick, mostly lemon, slowly giving way to a mix of musty basement funk, moderate sourness, and some dry wood tannins. The finish is a mix of dryness and lingering tartness.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Tart, musty, feel with plenty of it lingering through the finish.
O - Overall I really liked this one. It wasnt an over the top sour like some of the other Cantillon offerings I have had and it really hit the spot on this hot afternoon.
750ml bottle. Lemon, dust, sour apple,caramel, barnyard, hay, great grainy character. Great gueuze.

My Bottom Line :  
Peppery oak, white grapes and grapefruity hops ride this Gueuzes fine effervescence, while precise brettanomyces funk adheres to the fruity vivacity. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam covers the cloudy beige.
-The hop character on this one is perfectly cohesive. You can almost imagine that the house bacteria are responsible for the citrusy freshness.
-The sourness does not overtake the fruity hops. In fact, you could say both are nearly balanced.
-Brettanomyces feels more outgoing than the rest of the Cantillon funk signature.
-This, with Tilquin, is one of the best new Gueuzes Ive had in a long time. I need to find more.

Bottle.Earlier Rating: 4/20/2005 Total Score: 3.7The Lure:Tart orange rinds and lemons evoke the classic Cantillon sour funkiness. No new territory is discovered, but revisiting a personal favorite is always heartwarming.

The Festivities:Yeast prickles the ample lemon juice for a gum-drying aftershock. Feel is slick and tranquil, thus pointing towards the unblended lambics more than the blended. Easy-drinking for those used to the style, but still the intrinsic Cantillon intensity roams.

Transcendence:If people truly celebrated with gueuze, theyd never let the contents of the bottle explode and splatter all over.

750 ml bottle from Belgium. Opened with quite a pop, no gushing but it frothed up a bit. Pours a clear copper color with a large white head. A hoppy sweet nose with dry funkiness and caramel. The flavor comes across as a only slightly tart Gueuze mostly a sweet brew with some funkiness, lots of sweet dusty dry hops, light caramel and a bit of lemon. Nice, very mellow a easy drinking lambic. Earlier Rating: 12/12/2009 Total Score: 3.92006 vintage thanks to Eric, drank at the December 11th beer party. Pours a clear fizzy amber with a medium white head. The aroma is fruity and tart, lots of yeast. The flavor is great; super tart, fruity, but hard to pin down exactly what. A funky sort of straw. Very tart and nice.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutiken, Cph.
Hazy pale golden with a big, frothy, white head that fizzes away rather fast. Lovely funky, citric aroma, floral, roses, a bit of elderflower, bready hints. Highish carbonation, rather spritzy, good solid mouthfeel with nice dryness. Flavour is initially great citric, some orange zest, light dry barnyard notes, some birch leaves and woodruff. Lingering, zesty finish with soft milky notes and a good sharpness.Earlier Rating: 3/27/2009 Total Score: 4.2Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours hazy golden with a great, staying creamy, white head. Quite impressive for a gueuze. Aroma is funky, lemons, wood, oranges, vanilla and a slight peppery edge. Medium carbonation, great dry mouthfeel. Lovely tart, some lemons, funk, good dryness, orangse, wood and green apples. Sets itself apart from other gueuzes by being a) milder in tartness, b) lower in apple flavours, higher in citric flavour. This makes it far more drinkable for me than, say, Belle-vue Selection (which is more or less apple vinegar). Very nice, very balanced and incredibly drinkable.

75cl bottle. Hazy gold with a big white head. Big lemony, brightly acidic and dusty, musty Brett aroma. Very sour and dry like fizzy water with half a lemon in it. Lots of bright citrus and a little grassy earth in the finish. Dry, light bodied, and highly carbonated. maybe a little more lemony than classic gueuze, but pretty similar. Dont get much from the dry hops, but this bottle has to have some age on it my now. Very nice, very refreshingly sour lambic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy golden amber color. Aromas of wood, grass, yeast, some fruit and spice. Taste is yeasty, sour, can really taste the funk in this one.

12/11/2011 75cl bottle @ home - bottled: 25/1/2010 (2011-635) 
Very little cloudy orange beer, small off-white head, unstable. Aroma: Turkish delight, rose water, strawberries, grapefruit, dried apricot, some spices. MF: low carbon, medium to full body. Taste: citrus start, bitter grapefruit, bretta, a bit nutty. Aftertaste: lemon and grapefruit bitter. Very interesting to taste a bitter geuze.

Courtesy of bu11zeye. Hazy golden color with white foam. Mild barnyard, earhty, dusty pale malt aromas. Medium bodied. Big tart flavor at first gives way to dry pale, citrus wheat malts, with dandelion, grassy earthy barn yard stuff to finish--very good.Earlier Rating: 12/22/2008 Total Score: 3.9Bottled 2008 version. Clear dark gold with a thin but persistent head. Funky tart aromas of cherry, lemon with dry hay and dried drift wood.  Mildly tart sour with a prickly mouthfeel throughout. Nice dry wood, tart wheat malt flavors with dry lemon and cherry. Has just a mild aspirin burn in the finish. Very good gueuze.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Thanks to blazer06 for sharing this one.  Cheers, Zack!  Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head.  Nose is floral hops along with some malt, and a nice hit of vinegary tartness.  Flavor follows those lines.  Light to medium in body and a nice gueuze overall.

Bottled 75cl.  Practically indiscernible in colour from other gueuzes. Quick diminishing head. Quite strong on the grapefruit component in the nose. Vanilla, earthy hops, horse blanket and wormood throughout. Hoppier than the average Cantillon. Relatively strong sourness. Herbal. A gueuze I would personally recommend on a warm early spring day. Overall impression: A lovely hoppy delicious gueuze with a lot of character.Earlier Rating: 6/7/2010 Total Score: 3.6Bottled 750ml. It pours a hazy amber beer with a white head. This beer pours like sirup (!) -a remarkable viscosity. The nose is dominated by citrus fruit and so is the taste. Strong reminiscence of blood orange. Like drinking lemon sorbet which has melted. Plenty of character.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, small and fully diminishing head. Moderate, dryish and sour aroma, citrus fruitiness and some bitter hoppyness. Moderate, dryish and sourish flavor, citrus - grapefruit fruitiness. Finish is average, dry and sour, citrus - grapefruit fruitiness, light hoppyness. Too much citrus for me - light hoppyness is interesting though.

Bottle thanks to Owen. Pours golden straw with slightly off white head. Aroma of fresh grassy hops offset byu some green apple / lemony sourness. Really nice. Flavpours are perhaps a little more gueuze like with good sourness and only a touch of hop bitterness on the finish. Lively carbonation. Good stuff.

What a great beer this is from Cantillon. While many people dont really like the hop taste in a geuze, Cantillon did dry hopping on this one, with a very nice result. Off course not so sour as the other geuzes we are used to from jean, nontheless a great taste experience!Earlier Rating: 9/30/2011 Total Score: 3.9While this one is dry-hopped to get the hop taste in a geuze, which is normally not done, I really like the hoppy taste in it. Off course we are used to the more sour geuzes from Cantillon, its again a nice new experiment.

Draft @ chez moeder lambic / stone fest 
Head: thin , white 
Colour: gold 
Smell: yeasty, flowery, hops, dry citric , peely 
Taste: citric, sour, bitter, peely, dry yeasty, end is oranges and dry , aftertaste is fruity and grassy

Sampled from 750ml bottle. Poured a hazy orange color. Notes of sour fruits, apple, berries. A bit sour, but not too sour. I hate to sound completely uncultured, but beyond it being a decently crafted brew without any offensive notes, I didnt find anything that outstanding about this particular brew.

(750ml bottled Oct 4, 2010 huge thanks to bu11zeye) cloudy gold pour with a lasting cream eggshell white head, very effervescent in the glass. Nose of charred wood, barnyard funk, tangerine, lemon, and more wet/charred barrel as I smell this one. Taste is very tart lemon, wet wood, funk, super fresh, actually some bitter aged hops that integrate perfectly, delicious and refreshing. Probably the best gueuze I have ever had, even better than Lente, Millennium and 50th Anniversary perhaps. Complex and awesome!Earlier Rating: 4/23/2010 Total Score: 4.1(750ml bottle 2009 vintage thanks to blutt59) opaque golden pour with champagne like carbonation and head. Nose of cherry, wet barrel, very sour. Taste of very tart cherry, lemon, tangerine, vinegar, dried fruits. Nice carbonation, very tart finish. Great lambic.

750ml. bottle @ Akkurat.

Hazy orange with a short white head.

Aroma: Ripe apples, grapefruit, lemon, pips.

Taste: Acidic whithout going too far. Apples, sour white grapes, gooseberries and wood. But theres also hints of hoppy fruity notes like mango and apricot underneath.

Mouth: Fullbodied, a bit creamy with soft slightly tickeling bubbles.Earlier Rating: 8/20/2011 Total Score: 3.9Tap @ Akkurat. 
Hazy deep yellow/orange with almost no head.

Aroma is full of ripe yeasty sour apples with vinegar and wood.

Taste is classic Cantillon sharp sour with lots of sour apples and some lemon and lime. Theres a big earthy note from the apples with barrel notes. Hmmm... Dry bitter fruit stem ending.

Fullbodied with low but sharp carbonation.

Appley, woody dry and lovely.

light fruit aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, soft carbonation, nice sour fruity finish.

Bouteille de 750ml. Bière dorée trouble avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est fort agréable avec des notes dagrumes et de levure sauvage classique. La bouche est bien acide, rafraichissante, les goûts de brett bien présent. 8/10

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Dark yellow colour and hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Aroma of bread, light hoppy, herbs, horse blanket and barnyard. Mold. Flavor starts light sweet, then moderate acidic and bitter. More  yeast and stable. Dry texture and soft carbonation. Moderate astringent.Earlier Rating: 9/29/2008 Total Score: 3Medium yellow coloured. Hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Aroma of acid, sulfur, lightly acetic acid. Flavor is heavy acidic. Dry texture. Moderate astringent.

(75 cl)  Hazy golden in color with a sheet of foam.  Aromas of sour apple juice, lemons, bretts and wood.  Taste as citrus notes, vibrant bretts, oak and flowers.  Very good indeed.  Mouthfeel is very nice: the body is nearly medium with enough support from carbonation and a nice creamy to oily texture.  The finish is dry and acidic with some bitterness.  I enjoyed it.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Draught at Moeder Lambic, Brussels, for Zwanze Day 2011 as well as the Moeder vs Stone beer festival. Sampled on September 17, 2011This was rated as something else that recently became an alias, cant remember in my head which one it was and received no info of this either with the aliasing.Maybe "Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise"?Hazy to cloudy yellow color, to golden. Big, fluffy, lasting, dense white head. Acidic, almost sour, apricots, fruity, subtle wood scent. Acidic, sour, dry, apple, red currants peel taste. Dry acidic finish. Smooth mouthfeel, very low bitterness.8/4/8/4/17=4.1Earlier Rating: 12/16/2007 Total Score: 3.3First rating75 cl bottle purchased at Ölbutikken, Copenhagen Almost clear golden color and first pur, turns shady with the second. Very big head for its style, white. Smooth acidic scent, rather subtle in comparison to some of its cousins. Some almond paste also. Acidic to sour taste, a bit metallic and bitter lemon peels. Spritzy mouthfeel. Higher bitterness than expected, but perhaps not so much from hops than fruit peels of some sort.8/4/8/3/16=3.9RerateBottle at 3 Små Rum, Göteborg. August 2010Blind tastedCloudy yellow color, small white head. Sout with some sweet apples scent. Sour, but not too much, taste. Metallic aftertaste. Mdium mouthfeel, low bitterness.8/2/7/3/13=3.3
Sampled at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Lightly hazy yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste sour, but very pure and very balanced. Medium carbonation, low body.
Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  A huge gushing head erupts.  Hazy and light golden.  A bacteria culture smell.  Many might love this beer  but it is just not for me.

Thanks to Armin for this - had side by side with the cuvee des champions - this one was not as good - hazy, fizzy pour - light hop in the aroma, mild oak, moderately developed funk/horse blanket - no lacto noticeable - in the flavor, the German hops are very present, adding an almost fruity character that would go great with some lacto tartness, but this is not very present - moderate acidity and cheesy funkiness - needs some more time to develop, but still good.Earlier Rating: 3/10/2006 Total Score: 3.9Perfectly clear golden, with a lot more carbonation than Im used to seeing in Cantillon brews - a slightly grassy hop character in the aroma, along with the expected, cheesy, musty, barnyard smells - a unique sourness in this one; its almost tangy - quite dry - white wine character in abundance - a sour-apple, cider-like quality as well - background brett/cheesiness - quite nice stuff.

Bottle. Cloudy orange appearance with a white head. Really nice floral hoppy, moderately sour, nice lacto aroma. Pretty sweet, very nice tartness, lemony, awesome barnyard, lacto flavor. Really an amazing tart, slightly floral flavor. I wish I would have picked another one.Earlier Rating: 9/9/2011 Total Score: 4.2Bottle courtesy of Armin. Thanks! Mild grassy german hoppy, tart citrusy, moderately sour aroma. Moderately sour, lemony tart, barnyard flavor. Really a nice, smooth, moderately sour flavor with a fairly dry, musty finish. Nice beer.

Pours hazy yellow with white head, aroma has notes of cheese, funk, some slight grassy notes with a touch of lemon, some slight acetic notes with a lot of nice tart notes as well.  Taste is some lemon, slight grass and pine, with a touch of grain, lots of nice funk, cheese, with a touch of lactic sour, finishing nice and dry.  Delicious, the champions definitely won.Earlier Rating: 9/9/2011 Total Score: 4.3Bottle side by side with the st gilloise, thanks to Aaron for the bottle! Pour is nice hazy golden with white head, aroma has notes of some nice grass and pine hops, touch of citrus in there, leading to some cheese, barnyard, biscuit, really nice balance with lacto.  Taste is nice and hoppy, surprisingly up front with some nice pine and grass, lots of funk, cheese, big lacto bite with a nice dry finish.  Tasty and delicious!

Pours lightly golden and clear with a thin halo head.  Slightly acidic vineagar aroma with a decent earthiness to it.  Tastes lightly fruitiness and a bit of decompising earthiness.  Strong sour and acidic on the tongue with a wonderful earthiness and lightly fruitiness.  Finish is nicely sour and tart with a lip pucker.

Pours hazy copper with some what of a near white head. The aroma is modest in strength and offers up apricot skin, earthy mango fruit, some acidity and a bit of funk too. The taste is soured and more acidic tartness and those notes only grow the deeper into the flavor you get. In the background I noticed some berry notes and a faint wood sensation.

Bottle shared @ Daks Cantillon Tasting.  Traded one of these away and excited I got an opportunity to try it with friends.  14 karat pour with a small ivory head that diminished to nothingness rather quickly.  Aroma and flavor of lemon zest, earthy grassiness, grapefruit pith, and funk.  Medium to thin in mouthfeel although it does fill the palate better than others.Earlier Rating: 9/3/2011 Total Score: 3.5Bright tangerine pour with a small ivory head.  Aroma of horse blanket, heavy brett, Maytag Blue and grapefruit.  Lots of lemon grass and funk accompanying a bit of vinegar and citric acid.  Missing it in the body...water-like consistency.  Just not as dynamic, lip puckering, or complex as others.

Head is gone fast & this looks like old Cantillon lambic. This has a fascinating peach, half-dried apricot taste to it, overpowering a bit the traditional old Cantillon lambic taste, fascinating light herb, fruity hops in the back, sweet mould, light soap, sweet farmyard, the dryhopping does a lot to this stuff. The BBF date going to 2022 is interesting  mmm lovely.
Bottiglia. Aceto puro, mi dispiace ma era veramente in pessime condizioni. Penso la riproverò al più presto.

Draught @ Tivu. Hazy golden colour with a small white head. Sour aroma with earthly tones and some hops. Enamel-dissolving flavour which consists of green apples, some floral elements and earthly-leathery tones. Sour, fruity finish. Another nice gueuze from Cantillon.
Pours a cloudy apricot color with thin white head. Aroma has funk and cheese. Taste is sour/tart with some wood and a little bitterness. Thin bodied and water, the finish is tart.

(750ml bottle from Daks 5000 tasting).  Pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head.  Aroma has funk, must and some fruit.  Tast is tart/funky and has a little bit of vinegar and some slight bitterness.  Medium bodied with a dry finish.  Getting some peppery notes as it warms.  Nice beer!Earlier Rating: 8/23/2011 Total Score: 3.3(750ml bottle).  Pours a cloudy apricot color with thin white head.  Aroma has funk and cheese.  Taste is sour/tart with some wood and a little bitterness.  Thin bodied and water, the finish is tart.  A little disappointing, but this was sampled after Armand 4 lente and zomer so maybe that had an impact.

courtesy of the Erzbierschofs - hazy blond beer; nice lacework, white head; a good hop presence in top of notes of apples and vinegar; rounded and medium-bodied, a fair tart acidity and with a decent bitterness; long aftertaste, slightly salty with more fruity, light hoppy and dusty notesEarlier Rating: 8/27/2007 Total Score: 4.2courtesy of Papsoe; 2003-2004 - hazy golden colour with a firm white head; solid aroma of hay, cheese and vinegar; medium-bodied with some initial sweetness and a solid acidity (though pretty modest by Cantillon standards); the finish is a bit dusty and yeasty with notes of old apples and cellar along with a lingering acidity - a beautiful beer and probably the most approachable of the Cantillon

Deep gold pour, white head. Funky aroma, hay, barnyard, light tropical notes. Flavor is dry, sour, funky, dusty, floral notes. Earlier Rating: 11/27/2009 Total Score: 3.9Damn another good effort from cantillon. Nice funky sour aroma with a light earthy hop note. Flavor is sour and dry with good funk. Nice

375 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. Bottles 29.01.2010.
Pours a beautiful hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of ripe sour fruits, oak and loads of floral notes. Pretty intense flavour of sour apricot, green apples, oak, floral hops, flowers and leather. Lovely smooth mouthfeel and a sour and fruity finish. Well done.Earlier Rating: 9/18/2010 Total Score: 4.1375 ml bottle @ Oluthuone Kaisla. Bottled @ 29.1.2010.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a thick white head. Rich aroma of citrus, grapefruit, oak and floral hops. Very tart flavour of loads of grapefruit, orange and apricot. Very tart body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Tart, hoppy and dry finish. Very nice Gueuze.

37,5 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, bottled 29.01.2010, no BBE info
Sour and hoppy aroma with earthy notes. Flavour is very sour with earthy notes. Brilliant gueuze, I love the sourness here. The hoppiness feels a bit vegetable-like though.

A couple glasses given to me by Jean during my visit to the brewery January 2011.  They were bottling it this day.  Slightly hazy golden orange, with frothy white head.  Grassy (think green tea), flowers, orange peel, light musty barnyard, tartness, and apple.  Hoppy for a lambic as expected, not very sour, but still quite enjoyable with complexities.  Very glad to have tried it.Earlier Rating: 7/30/2010 Total Score: 3.7Sample at Stone Sour Ale Fest 2010. Yellow pour, thin white head.  Dry sourness, lemon, funk, apple, light dusty malt, and hops in the finish.  Interesting lambic.

Cantillo st guillose. 750ml bottle thanks to Shawn for sharing...  
Pours a hazy orangey bien hue and topped with a fluffy white head...  
Earthy grassy with a light metllic note. Not pungent in a funk or horseblanket sense. Fairly subdued... Flavors have a bit more quality with a rustic grassiness. Not too much of a pronounced funk or horseblanket quality. Soft bodied with a similar level of carbonation.  Prefer more of a funked up cantillon lambic as this was a touch more subdued with more of a grassy hop focus.
Earlier Rating: 6/7/2008 Total Score: 3.5750ml botttle (2003-2004 vintage) from a recent trade with BDr.....a hazy and muted light apricot orange pour with a very thin white head that had minimal longevity..... solid aroma of stinky funk, horseblanket tartness and acidic citric notes.....flavors added much of the same but perhaps more grapefruit comes through. slighty acidic but not overly so.  what was somewhat disappointing was the mouthfeel as it was a little thin.  finish was dry

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2011 From tap at Akkurat, July 2011

Appears golden orange with a small white head in the tumbler glass Im tasting from. The aromas are an intense flowery and fruity sensation with a wide spectra of sour notes. The normal gueuze fragrances of earth and barnyard are bound to the background and the fresh hops are allowed to dominate the aroma. A lot of citrus, elderflower and apple action going on from the hops. The dryhopping is defiantly noticeable and very pleasant.


As I go into drinking this I can feel how sweet and aromatic it is. Dont get me wrong its sour as well, the balance of it is just superb. Throughout the whole experience there is a nice acidic and sour theme, the hops just adds another dimension for me. The mouthfeel and carbonation is spot on and its extremely drinkable. This exceeded my expectations. If you ever get the chance to sample it fresh, dont miss out!

75cl bottle courtesy of Kermis.
Decent white head.  Hazy blond pour.  Not my cup of tea.  A little too sour.
Bottle @ Chrisos pre-GBBF tasting. Poured a cloudy gold, with a small white head. Sweet, tangy orange, orange rind and a hint of sherbert

10 bottle from James - thanks!  Copper/orange and yellow glow in the glass with a very large frothy white head and heavy carbonation.  Aroma is light cheese rind funk, soft oak, and medium tart/sour.  Taste is earthy tart/sour up front that grows in intensity through the finish - almost a slight, dry-champagne type tinge on the end.  Theres a bit of cheese rind on the very end of the finish but its minor compared to the dominant tart/sour flavors.  As with all Cantillon, crisp and precise feel in the mouth.  Cheers Jean - youre the master!

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Cantillon Cuvée Saint-Gilloise; Bottle Date 4th October 2010; Sampled August 2011A steady pour into my Lost Abbey Teku glass produces an initially two finger thick head that slowly rises to be an additional almost two-fingers above the rim of my glass; the head has lots of staying power, falls with a varied, rocky surface and even leaves some lacing on the sides of my glass; you really cant ask much more from this beer visually.   The beer is a pale amber color that shows an almost clear, rich, straw-gold hue when held up to the light.  The beer smells of ample lactic acidity (grapefruit and lemon like at times) as well as a solid backing of urea like aromatics.  Behind this is a dried hay and crushed pale grain aromatic; with other aromatic notes this makes me think of a dried field of grass, weeds and wildflowers.  This actually does have quite a bit or herbal / wildflower like aromatic notes to it.  Typical Lambic notes that are musty, slightly musky, sort of dusty, wood shavings, touches of spicy oak, woody pepper that has lost its spice piquancy, .  Woody, herbal and dried grass aromatics seem to dominate the nose after a while, but if you really, really dig, a bright, almost-lemon like note becomes noticeable.

Bracingly tart, with a prickly, effervescent and lively carbonation as this rolls across the palate for the first time.  The beer finishes with some astringent, woody herbal character as well as some tannic oak notes.  An ample lactic acidity provides a nice, clean, biting sourness to this beer that accentuates soft notes of sour-grapefruit and perhaps lemon; though lactic acid never really tastes like this.  The finish has a hint of musky, phenolic, wild / funky yeast character to it.  The body is certainly light and spritzy (from the carbonation), but still manages to have a creamy texture to it at times; this last is likely a combination of the slickness from lactic acid and from the tannic oak structure; the texture of this beer is pretty close to perfect for a Gueuze (or more correctly a carbonated Lambic).  There is a hint of chalkiness to this beer, though it is mostly drowned out by the spicy, herbal hop character.  Some pale grain character contributes a straw like note, some sourdough like bread-character in the middle and some lingering cracker like notes in the finish; the straw / hay flavors are boosted by the hops it seems.

Compared to a Pale Ale or IPA, the dry hopping here is fairly subtle, but there is enough that it substantially influences the character of this beer; interestingly enough the Hallertauer Hops integrated very well with the Lambic flavors, so much so that you could easily miss them, or think the extra complexity came from somewhere else.  The dry hops definitely add an interesting character to the nose, it seems to accentuate the woodiness a bit, bring out more of the straw aromatics from the grain, but also contribute a wildflower like spiciness as well as a sort of herbal character; the hops are not really an aggressive part of the aroma though, and I could see missing them if I didnt know about them, or if one wasnt comparing this to a normal Gueuze.  This is actually really, really good; it blows the Armand4 Oude Geuze Lente I had the other day out of the water (and I really liked that one), the main reason for this is that this beer doesnt have any acetic acid character to it, which the Lente did have.  This beer has reinspired me to explore dry hopping in sour beers; I think it can be done well as long as it is not done too much.Earlier Rating: 9/18/2005 Total Score: 42004 bottling, Sampled September 2005
Pours a hazy straw-orange color with a hint of ruby-grapefruit colored notes.  The carbonation seems quite low, as the cork did not pop at all when pulled, it is carbonated though, but the head is wispy and a frothy pale color.  Ah, the aroma; a suitable funky smell greet my nostrils as I take my first draught of the nose.  The aroma is a mix of citrus, funky notes of mushroom, perhaps some notes of farmhouse cheese, and musty earth.  The Brett character is quite pronounced, and the aroma just keeps the senses piqued for continued sniffing pleasure.

The beer is of course shockingly tart in the first sip, after that is through it becomes pleasingly tart with a bracing note of acidity.  The beer is quite light, and has just enough carbonation to enhance the spritzy refreshing character.  I do think that there is a bit of grassy herbal character here too from the dry hopping in the cask.  This has a nice note of tart grapefruit, and is not nearly as funky in the taste as the nose suggests.  There is a light note of funky cheese in the finish that seems to linger a bit in an astringent manner after the beer has been swallowed.

As this beer warms up it really begins to soften a bit, open up, and become quite a bit more fruity with lots of grapefruit and lemon notes.  This is definitely quite enjoyable, and I definitely do not enjoy Lambics enough, it is definitely a special occasion type beer for me, and I would much prefer that it was an everyday beer for me.

<font size=-4>Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson, AZ<font size=-1>

Multiple glasses of this at Ebenezers.  Aroma is light and tart, a bit of white grape, cheese, low bitterness.  Mouthfeel is delightful, ultra light and dry.  Flavor is sour but lightly so, hints of white grape and soft cheese.  YumEarlier Rating: 11/13/2010 Total Score: 4.1@Lord Hobo post NOTF
pale golden pour into the glass, a touch of fizzy off white head.  Aroma is herbal hop, musty earth floor basement, some light grapefruit(white) acidity.  Flavor is much the same, very nice persistent herbal hop bitterness is refreshing and compliments the musty grapefruit very nicely.  Delightfully savory

750mL corked bottle.  Poured hazy light amber color with off-white head and thin lacing.  Smells of aroma hops and citrus.  Taste is mildly sour and bitter.  Good mouthfeel from the carbonation and body.  I enjoyed this beer because I could actually taste some hop bitterness, which is lacking from most lambics.

I had no less than 6 glasses of this on my most recent Ebenezers bender. Absolutely fantastic to drink in the summertime. Citrusy hoppy funk, light fruit nectar, acetic acid, grassy herbals, and cheesy oak-funk found off with a medium body with ample caressing carbonation. An awesome pucker fest. Earlier Rating: 10/19/2009 Total Score: 4.3Opaque apricot pour with a small but lively white head. Aroma is tart nectar fruits- apricot, apple, and pear, yielding some light barnyard funk, lemon, and an ever so subtle perfume hop character. Flavor begins with light fruity notes- tart apple and pear, and in its wake follows a massive funk profile. Dry hopping is noticable but definitely doesnt act to steal the spotlight in anyway- a creative and well done touch. Farm yard, horse blanket, leather, and a huge tart character. Palate is quite effervescent, slippery, and dry with a lingering funk character that just wont go away. I am very impressed!

Bottle at Chrisos. Really mellow nose, malty, with some cereals and a bit of yogurt. Sour, funky flavor, rather dry, dirty but mellow. Quite dry but sweeter than the regular geuze. Good, not quite great.

Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 11. It pours hazy orange-amber, with a thin foamy beige head and moderate carbonation. The nose is eggy sourness, lemon, sour green apple, hay and grass. The taste is sour Granny Smith apple, lots of lemon, lemon zest, grass, wood and hay, with a dry-tart finish. A tasty hoppy gueuze. Yum.

Bottle (from the november 2005 RB-tasting at Dixens place - notes have been damaged by flooding of my basement, but this was such an insane tasting for me as I was new to such massive tastings, so I gave up on the detailed notes quite early). Fresh, not so sour. All that was readable...

On tap at Ebenezers. Cloudy golden pour. Nose holds awesome funky yeast and hops. Flavor is great tart, unripe peach and apricot, cheesecloth, and hoppy funk. Earlier Rating: 10/19/2009 Total Score: 4Pours a cloudy apricot with a small, bubbly white head. Aroma holds lots of tart citrus, some funk tied to light nectar fruit notes, rather than barnyard or hay. The impact of the dry hopping is also evident, with floral, perfume, and lemon aspects. Flavor starts with the same tart citrus and nectar notes, but near the middle of the taste the funk accelerandos into the forefront, with more horse blanket ideas than in the aroma. The finish holds an interesting effervescence, much like a champagne or even a kristallweizen, that may come from the re-fermentation. Palate is lively on the tongue, and, though tart, oh so drinkable. Another excellent lambic from Cantillon.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 At Chriso Pre Gbbf 2011.  Cloudy gold lasting beige.  Good subtle sour aroma.  Decent in mouth.  Like the sourness.  Good beer.  Nice enoughEarlier Rating: 8/5/2005 Total Score: 3.9Bottle at GBBF
Cloudy gold lambic.  Good oaky nose and the sourness in the mouth with the citric acidity is pretty intense.  Best straight lambic I have had so far.  Drinking this after all those heavy American IPAs is just so refreshing 3.6/5.  Glass at Cantillon.  Hazy gold, lasting cream head.  more fresh aroma, fresh hallertau.  Some sherbert on end.  Really drinkable, only slightly tart,  But just delicious.  So drinkable.  The sherbert is delightful.

A Mes rate. At Chris Os pre GBBF.Firstly thanks muchly to Olly for bringing this. Secondly, this is pretty good but Cantillon can do much better. Full on lemon, slightly meaty, decent sourness but fairly restrained for a Cantillon. I dunno, Im trying my best to put my finger on what it is that doesnt sit right with me but I really cant. Bottom line, its good, but I really expected better compared with the old version. Earlier Rating: 8/28/2007 Total Score: 4.4A Mes rate: 
Bottle at RBESG purchased from the fabulous Ølbutikken. Maybe not quite so complex and deep as most  of Jeans gueuzes but I would guess this is down to the choice of blend. That said it is still a stunning beer with all the barnyard funk and sourness you would expect from this awesome blender. Slight initial sweetness is totally unexpected but it is instantly washed away by the usual lemon and other citric fruit acidity and finishes with a wonderful gush of hops. Dry hopping lambics really works for me and this is certainly the best example I have had. Cantillon I love you.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2011 750 ml bottle from Brussels. Hazy amber bodt with small-medium off-white head. Aroma is quite funky with some noble hops. Lots of barnyard, horseblanket and so on. Lemons. Taste is medium sour (for a lambic), dry and no sweetness. Medium bodied with nice carbonatio and very good balance. The sourness is a bit milder than many geuzes but that might be good for the balance. Overall, really nice.

On draft at Beer Revolution.  Pours a hazy, light amber with a a two finger fluffly white head that has good retention and leaves a small amount of lacing on the glass.  The aroma is a decent earthiness, funky brett, hay, and some lemon tartness.  The taste has the same earthiness as the aroma.  Medium tartness, some wheat, hay lemon.  The finish has a strong brett funkiness as well as a lingering bitterness that is quite unique among the gueuzes Ive had.  Medium body.  Medium carbonation.  Awesome beer.
hazy darkgolden pour with bright white medium head. Sour citrus nose Dry awesome. Quick finish. Light body. Just great.

A: The pour on this one is the usually hazy golden-orange color with a nice white head.

S: An incredibly funky nose to this, much more so than the regular Cantillon gueuze.  An almost blue cheese level of funk with some nice straw and must along with the usual tartness of green apple and lemon.

T: The tartness is there, though perhaps a bit more moderate than some other Cantillon beers.  Lots of funkiness here, too.  Intensely earthy and barnyardy with lots of wet hay and grass.  A bit of damp oak and must, too.

M: Medium in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: I think I still prefer regular Cantillon Gueuze, but this was really quite good.
Bottle @ Kaisla, Helsinki. Originally rated on 17.9.2010. Tasty, slightly hoppy and fruity gueuze.

Sampled at PIB. Pours a cloudy/amber/gold with a small white dissipating head. Aroma of tropical soured fruits, peach, lemon. Flavour potently soured fruits, slightly stale flavour and quite bitter. Dry, and nothing artificial about it.

750 ml bottle shared by lushawn. Thanks! Pours a murky golden amber hue, good haze, with a frothy whitish head that is good sized, dies to a thick layer and laces a-ok. Aromas are dense and rich, citrusy lemons and oranges take control with melons and grapefruit, wet oak, with bread, wet cheese, some yogurt. A good citrusy bite, with some dry florals and grass. Decent funk, as the yogurty presence becomes more powerful. Initial is spritzy and well carbonated, a nice prickly citrus bite, lemons and oranges, grapefruits, tart and sour fruits with some pineapple, lingering lactic acid, wet oak, bread, yogurt, and some soft funky cheese, though more gentle. Lingering sourness, with potent lactic sourness, not too acidic, but really nice, some dry hops, wet oak, yogurt. Really nice, vibrant flavors, complex, with a great sour bite for the sourhead in you. Really nice, younger funk that doesnt asssert itself. Some touches in the nose, a touch more in the body. Really, a display of fruity sourness keeping away from the heavy acid feel. Great beer here.

Bottle bought at the brewery about a year ago. Hazy golden with a small white head. Sour and hoppy aroma, where the hops are mainly fruity. Sour, funky and barnyardy taste where the fruity hop notes are less present than in the aroma.

Bottle via a trade. Pours with a hazy golden body and a lasting white head. Aromas are odd, hoppy, fruity, lactic acid, light chlorine, funk, horseblanket. Flavors are a bit bitter, fruity, funky and acidic. Sharp, dry, wood. Hoppy, citrus, straw and funk. Medium bubbles, tannic. Good.Earlier Rating: 4/10/2010 Total Score: 3.9Bottle with many thanks to blutt59. I guess this is a 2009 bottle from the cork. Pours with a large, off-white head and a hazy golden body. Aroma of citrus, pineapple, horseblanket, funk, acidic and wet wood. Taste is kind of hoppy, bitter, acidic, citrus, corky, and awesome. Mouthfeel is acidic with lively carbonation, and a lot of sourness.

Shimmering gold, small bubbled white head. Nose is herbal, floral hop that is a bit dusty and showing some leather. Flavor has a ton of grapefruit at the front, also pine, wheat, and brett thats relatively tame for Cantillon. More grapefruit and tightening acids at the back, grape skin all over the tongue and mouth in the finish. Earlier Rating: 2/12/2010 Total Score: 4.4Opaque gold with faint orange, a moderate white head that drops to thin, bubbly film. Nose is citric, sweaty, and very dusty, the malt non-existent in the presence of the hop bitterness. Flavor is similar, lots of dust and sweat, moderate acidity, a blast of lemon and grapeskin in the finish. This isnt among my favorite gueuzes given the toned down, less fruity approach, but its still an excellent example of quality, particularly the way the beer mutes the traditional wheat tone for a dryer, more direct funk.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 On tap at PIB, pours cloudy golden orange with a white head. Aroma of sour fruits (particularly peach and lemon), big funkiness and big tartness. Flavour is very tart - citric and lemon, with a very dry finish. Great gueuze, but inferior to the classic gueuze.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Corked bottle. Golden color. hazy. Oak, grapefruit, pineapple and grassy, citric hops in the aroma. Thinnish and sour with lots of lemon, grapefruit, oak. pineapple and grassy hops. Long finish. Complex. A pleasure to drink

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange. Big fluffy white head. Nose of funky lemon, oak, wild yeast and tart citrus. Taste of grapefruit rind, wild yeast, truffle salt, tart funky lemon and oak. Aroma is citrus tart. Taste is sour lemon with varying complexity in each sip. Rated 8/13/08
Dark yellow with a big white head.  Sour, slightly grainy aroma. taste is the same, with bright citrus (lemon) acidity, and toasty notes with a bit of underlying Brett.  2/tasting

Bottle 37,5 cl @ Gastropub, Tampere. Pours cloudy golden amber with a big fuzzy off white head leaving small lacing. Aroma is nicely fruity, a bit sweet, acidy, sour, earthy and malty. Refreshing sour fruity mouthfeel. Flavor like aroma, sourness near of lemon juice. Finishes with a nice sour fruity and dry aftertaste, trailing with a pleasant fruity cheek feeling.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2012 Aroma: lemon, citrus, pomegrate
Appearance: lemon, unclear
Taste: sour, fresh, citrus
Palate: medium body.
Overall: 20/20

Straw colored with a hint of caramel. Big white head that fades quickly and leaves no lacing behind. Very fizzy, bubbles continue to rise the entire drink. Slight funky brett aroma. Slight corn aroma. A sweet mouthfeel with some tart refreshing sourness. Very good tartness. Nice tasting beer that is refreshing, especially on this super-hot day.

750 ml bottle. A hazy medium blonde beer with a huge, fizzy, lacing, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is lightly malty, lightly hoppy, moderately to heavily yeasty. There are notes of toasted grain, flowers, lemon, wood, barnyard, earth, horseblanket, with a touch of green apples and mold. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, heavily acidic. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, fizzy carbonation, dry long finish with light to medium bitterness. Overall a truly outstanding aroma, yeasty, complex. The taste is very sour, but not at the level of some other Cantillon beers, like FouFoune, for example, Some astringency in the finish. Really good, but no wonder.
On tap. Again another special beer from Cantillon which never lets down me. The taste is not too much acid, medium carbonation and a little bit bitter. Very good.
Pours a fading off-white head with a golden body.  Aromas of bitter lemon, barnyard.  Flavor is lemon, tart, slight wood and vanilla.  Finish is dry and lasting bitter lemon rind.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2012 Bottled sample via savvy1982. Gold in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of meyer lemon, sour peach, delicate herbal/earthy hops and driftwood. Definitely more citrus fruit forward in the mouth than expected, backed by some mild lactic sourness, damp earth, and a fair bit of old barrel. Mildly acidic, but far less so than many of the other Cantillon products Ive tried, so its a bit flat on the tongue. Flavour wise, it seems a bit disjoint at this point... perhaps a bit less than the sum of its parts. That being said, I could still see this evolving into something really good with some more time in the cellar, albeit at the expence of the dry-hop element.Earlier Rating: 12/5/2009 Total Score: 4.2An early Christmas preasent from oakbluff (thanks buddy!). Bottled sample, 2009 vintage. Pale golden in colour with strong and spritzy carbonation. Aromas are of lemon, oak barrel, sour apple skin,  a bit of fresh grass, and very mild funk. Flavors are of grapefruit, lemon, old wood, a bit of cheese curd, and a bit of herbal hop. Refreshing and clean finishing. A classic and elegant gueuze to say the least.

750ml green bottle, corked and capped. Bright yellow and hazy with a light layer of white foam. Nose is full of citrus - lemony, sweaty. Flavour is lemony, tart, acidic, underlying fruits, maybe green apple.  Finishes with lemon peels, acidic and dry with wheat-like hints and some tart apples.  Medium body, light in the mouth, carbonation is very light. Tasty blend, super drinkability.

Thanks to Casey for this... nice golden pour, good carbonation... barnyard funky nose... the taste is more musky than sour, pretty good gueuze but I prefer the classic Earlier Rating: 3/26/2011 Total Score: 4.1The beer pours a light hazy gold with a decent white head and retention. Not much lacing here.

The aroma is prety nice and strong with a balance of nice tart horse funk and some hops. One of the first times I could get hops in a lambic.

The taste is like the aroma, nice funk with a hop finish. 

The feel is nice with a dry finish and very drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 17th May 2009At Plan B. Huge thanks to Jacob (Hildigoltur) for pulling from his cellar and sharing. Clear amber beer. Super sour and dry. Slightly rounded off and it lacks the lemon acid of some gueuze but still pretty dry and sour. Just not my bag man! 2.4 15th April 2015Craft Clerkenwell. Bruces UK Swan Song. My sour palate has come a long way since 2009. Light wet wood, mild dried fruits, little lemon and a trace of orange. Airy finish. Approachable and drinkable.
Tap at RnH in the beers done wild aftermath - oaky funk, very yeasty, ton of grapefruit, licking lemons, puckering tart, doughy, touch, of bile & smooth.

Ausgeglichene säuerlicher aber auch etwas süßer Antrunk; der Hopfen und später die Bitterkeit stechen hervor. Beim anschließenden Abflachen des Bieres bleibt die Säuerlichkeit noch im Hintergrund vorhanden. Ausgewogen, stimmig, sehr harmonisch. Zum Ende allerdings zu flach. /11/12/12/12/11

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 75cl bottle at home vintage 2010. The aroma is of hops, funk and peaches. The pour presents an apricot coloured beer with a lasting fluffy White head. The flavour is outstanding. If you told me that this was a peach lambic then I would believe it. Extremely well balanced with the sourness which creates a spritzy easy drinking geuze. This is fantastic stuff and a 750 can easily be consumed by yourself! 

75cl bottle in São Paulo, Vintage 2004. This is the rare first bottling of Cuvee Des Champions. Consumed September 2013. This is simply stunning! The hops have faded so much that they are undetectable. This is very much tasting like a Gueuze of a similar vintage however this has a depth to it that the standard Gueze of the same vintage. The colour is darker, the carbonation a bit stronger but its the aroma and taste! Long gone is the fresh apricot and peach hop profile. However whats left is a Gueuze with a fudgey cognac aroma and taste. I could smell this for days!!  Sourness is still very well balanced and youd have no problem finishing this old bottle and wanting more! Stunning!! 

Extra note! Ive tried this beer with 3-4 years on it and it goes through a flat spot where its not too great however if you let it age past this to 10 years it gets truly wonderful! Fresh or with 10 years this is sublime.

Bottle courtesy bu11zeye. Murky brownish orange color. Foamy white head. Aroma is funky and sour with sharp fruit, wood rot and powder. Flavor is SUPER tart and sour with some wood flavors and tart fruit. Sourness continues through the finish. Still not my thing.

Draught at Moeder Lambic. Dry hopped, formerly Cuvee des Champions, so i was told. Pours cloudy orange, white whispy head. Nice citrus tinge behind horse blanket funk. light bodied, effervescent. Fruity undertones - green apple, apricot. Medium sourness. Dry hopping cuts some of the sour kick. Backdoor green tea.

Bouteille de 750 ml, édition 2010. Arômes très intéressants de houblon floral, de brettanomyces et de pamplemousse blanc. Le dry-hop se fait vraiment sentir, si on prend pour référence le nez de la gueuze Cantillon classique. Robe orangée et légèrement trouble, effervescence active et belle mousse. En bouche, on retrouve une très belle complexité de citron, de pamplemousse blanc et de paille. Cette bière présente vraiment une personnalité rappelant les agrumes. Le houblon floral est également présent, mais plus discret quau nez. Longue finale lactique et citrique. Une autre très belle bière de Cantillon!
At rattle n hum during beers gone wild.  Candi sugars, champagne characteristics... Overall light and too tame for my liking.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity funky sour tart aroma with hoppy hints. Fruity sour tart funky weak hoppy flavor. Has a fruity sour tart citrus finish. Earlier Rating: 3/8/2006 Total Score: 3.9Golden colour with a white head. Barnyard and hoppy aroma. Flavor is sour and fruity with some hints of hops. A little bitter aftertaste.
On tap at Moeder Lambic. Dark golden body with tiny, oily head. Nose sugary and sour. Taste sour, malty, fruity with grapefruit. Nice bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2012 375ml bottle (St. Urhos, Helsinki) as Cuvee Saint Gilloise
7 lovely crisp lambic, soft, but some grapefruit
3 mid orange, slightly hazy
8 stunning crisp retronasals. sharp and sour, with some prominant grapefruit. Nectarine there too, lovely.
4 crisp and sharp, glorious bite. So dry.
16 Cantillon at their best. A massively drinkable beer, but so much character. Fruity, without having any fruit, how do they do that? sweet than the brouxella gran cru, but not actually sweet.Earlier Rating: 1/14/2008 Total Score: 3.5375ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki), branded as "Pikkulintu".
Hazy gold, no head. Sour lambic aroma - dry hoppy hints too. Apricot in the taste on top of a standard Cantillon lambic backdrop. Very tasty - well balanced sharpness. Long pleasant finish. (6:3:7:4:15=3.5)

Flaska på Basunen 2011: Jag har aldrig sätt så stort skum på en geueze tidigare.
Doften är otrolig frisk, syrlig och med tydliga kryddertoner. Smaken är len men ändå med en stor härlig syrlighet. Fruktig och lång eftersmak. Helt underbar.

Bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, pours a cloudy soapy golden color with a  chalk and pepper aroma, flavor is not overly sour with grape must, funk, hoppy grape peels Earlier Rating: 4/21/2010 Total Score: 3.8bottle, cloudy orange pour with some frothy white foam, aromas of chalky lemons, nice flavor of salty lemonade, musty , dry finish, one of the better Cantillon to me not too tart

Tried this directly at the Cantillon brewery. Golden in the glass, zippy, nice small head. Hoppy-sourish aroma, almost a bit IPA-like. Starts mild fruity, gets more and more sourish, background interesting hoppy. Finish well balanced. Really a beer to enjoy.

Bottle shared by OSCF - thanks, Todd! Nice earthy golden pour, with a crisp cracklin head. Nose is very inviting, and I really dug the combination of the noble hops and gueuze funk. Nice full body, playful mouthfeel. This general kind of thing seems vaguely consistent with NB Le Terroir, in terms of dry hopped sours. Tart fruits emerge a bit once you get further into the beer, with a finish thats not overwhelmingly acetic but instead balances the funk and the hops. Really well done.Earlier Rating: 2/12/2010 Total Score: 4.1750ml from State Line. I wasnt entirely sure what to expect from a dry-hopped gueuze. Pours a deeper yellow than Id anticipated as well, with a vigorous carbonation thats very appealing. Soft lemon zest and a riot of yeasty elements in the nose, a bit of wood and old armchair. Nice funk and ripe fruits, and I love the way the dry hopping gives the beer a crispness that seems to bring together all the complex flavors really nicely. Would love a case of this to lay down in the cellar.

Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is heavy on the grass and lemons with a light bit of Cantillon funk mixed in. The flavor is a great mix of tart lemons, light to medium funk, some lactic tartness and some wheat. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A great gueuze. Earlier Rating: 4/18/2010 Total Score: 4Thanks to blutt59 for sharing this bottle. I have been looking forward to trying this beer for a long time.

2009 vintage. The beer pours a murky yellow color with a white head. The aroma is tart lemon with some oak and earthy qualities. The flavor is heavy on the lemon tartness with some oak notes. There is not as much funk as I was expecting. The beer is very acidic and is very, very dry which forces you to drink more and more. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2011 Pours a hazy gold body with a large frothy white head.  Aroma is citrusy, earthy, and pine like.  Mouth feel is medium in body and warmth with a biting finish.  Flavor is DIVINE: tart, with a hint of vinegar, skunk, grass, citrus, and rotten egg.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a hazy golden body with a fizzy white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, grass, cobwebs, and horse blanket.  Flavor of grapefruit, lemon, lacto, brett, subtle passion fruit, straw, and grass with a dry, moderately bitter finish.  Excellent.Earlier Rating: 7/11/2005 Total Score: 3.9(750ml bottle, 2003/2004 vintage)  Pours a clear deep golden body with a spare white lacing.  Aroma of citrus tartiness, earthiness, mold, and mustiness (basement).  Mildly tart flavor with some earthiness.  Mildly acidic.

75cl bottle at Cantillon, courtesy of Travlr - Prosit!
Golden color with a white head. Flowery spicy aroma with some funky notes, some must. The flavor is sour but less musty then you normaly would expect due to the quite young age and the powerfull flavors of the hops which include even some pine notes and a dry hoppy finish which definetely comes from the bitterness then from the sourness.
Good geuze but a little bit too young, however this will (like Orval) vary from person to person.

Bouteille verte de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de fleurs et dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goûte dagrumes légèrement acides avec une pointe sèche. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement acide. (Rating #3631)

Tasted on 5/4/11 from a 750mL crown capped and corked bottle purchased at Fine Wine Brokers, according to the .  Pours hazy orange with a massive white head that slowly settles into thin, even lace.  The nose is sour, citrus, and funky with vanilla oak, and a bit of spicy green hops underlying.  The flavor is acidic, sour, and funky with light vanilla oak, and some spicy and bitter hops on the back of the palate.  The body is light with fizzy carbonation and a long sour, acidic, and lightly bitter hops finish.

Bottle at First German Ratebeer gathering at Idar Oberstein.  Musty/barnyard lemon peel, peach, white grape and malt aroma.  Hazy golden yellow color with minimal head.   Sweet lemon flavor up front followed by sour/dry barnyard malt and citrus peel finish.  Slightly tannic finish.  Very tasty - for sourheads definitely.

Bottle at the first German local RateBeer tasting at Wasaba in Idar-Oberstein.  Courtesy of shrubber85 - thanks!  Bright clear golden color, huge fluffy white head.  Aroma of dusty grapefruitand ladys armpits (but in a good way!).  Taste is pink grapefruit with solid brett sourness.  Light body.  Needs more age to build additional character and complexity..  Described by a German as toilet bowl cleaner.  Oh well, lambics and gueze are an acquired taste - more for us!Earlier Rating: 11/29/2008 Total Score: 4.6Available on draught at the Bier Circus in Brussels as their house beer.  Cloudy yellow/orange appearance with scant white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and wet horseblanket.  Typical Cantillon sour taste, but with more with lemon and grapefruit.  Nice dry finish.  This and the Girardin Faro are two good reasons to try this bar if youre in Brussels.  4.0.
Bottle, from a trade on BA.  Aroma is more intense, taste is more sour and complex.  Re-rate at 4.6.

Tap at Churchkey under the new name of  Cuvée St-Gilloise.  Sorry that the team is not doing as well, Jean!  This version was tasty, but lacked the complexity of the draft or bottled version tied previously.  3.8.

Part of the first German beer tasting in Idar-Oberstein. Thanks to Travlr. 750 ml bottle. Is an amber hazy color with a white head. Aroma is sour, sour and somemore sour. Taste was nearly undrinkable. Palate was sour like an unwashed woman if you get my drift. Yet another Belgium desert beer that I did not like. Again we had fun passing this one around to the local Germans and watching their twisted faces as they sampled it.

750ml bottled January 29, 2010. Pours a pale golden hue, nice carbonation and a nice even creamy white head. Farmhouse is the overwhelming nose, some tartness, grass, floral and something sweet.  Interesting taste - barnyard continues, mild sourness, very mild and light with a dry, Chardonnay finish. Very different from other Cantillon that I have had but still like it - need to be in the mood for something mild and barnyardish (almost Fantome like).

Bottle at Jan & Charlottes tasting, Ulfborg, Denmark 09.04.11 cheers Jan & Charlotte   Pours heavy yellow with a white head. Really lemony and very puckering and drying. This is incredibly tart and quite pushy. Like many Cantillon, its just a bit too much on the sharp and sour side for me. However I can appreciate this.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14  3.6

Bottle 750ml. @ UK-SCO Tasting in Ulfborg.[ Courtesy of Fin ]. Light unclear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy barnyard, leather, citrus, tart sour citrus, brett. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a average to long duration, citrus, dry dry. IMO maybe a bit young. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20110409]Earlier Rating: 1/31/2010 Total Score: 4.2Bottle 75cl. @ home. [ As Cantillon Cuvée du 89 ].  [ Vintage Bottled 2004 ]. [ As my rating # 12345 on ratebeer ].  Clear sparkling medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is grape, leather, wood, wood pencel, fruity notes, light barnyard. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, and a dry finish. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily and dry, carbonation is soft. Not as sour - tart as some other geuze, but very easy to drink with a big smile. ;O)) [20090512]

Bottle @ J & Cs, Ulfborg. Thanks. Pours cloudy golden with a small creamy white head. Lots of Barnyard, brett and citrus. Lively carbonation. Crisp and tart. Very young and refreshing..Earlier Rating: 2/5/2008 Total Score: 4.1Rating # 1300. Bottle from Biercircus as Cuvee du 89. Bottle 37,5cl - vintage 2004. Pours hazy orange with a fine egg white head. Sprinkly & fizzy but quite lasting. Aroma & taste  is sour, fruity, vinegar, white wine - vinous, tart & wood. Like always very sour, fresh & dry. Amazing experience! Cant wait to visit Belgium & cantillon again!

Draught at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Slightly hazy yellow to copper color. Tart, flowery and perfumed aroma with notes of ginger and meadowsweet. Acidic flavor with grapefruit, ginger, orange pith, elderberry,  yarrow and sulfur. Unusual and exotic Cantillon.
bottle at jans ... light golden amber ... tight bubbly head ... sharp citrus lemon sourness ... sharp lemon front ... funky barnyard ... much what id expect ... not me ... very puckering

Courtesy of Dennis (Pinball)Cloudy blond color; generous head, frothy. The aroma is old school pungent, with dry Bretts, almost citrusy; fresh and aggressive like a young gun. The mouthfeel is very dry; the Bretts character is very high, so the acidity; citrusy character, like bergamot juice; the final has a mild astringency. Aggressive.Overall, this beer has a better aroma than flavor, it tastes young, its very enjoyable.Earlier Rating: 5/14/2006 Total Score: 3.5Hazy blond color; huge head, very lively; wonderful fine perlage. Classic aroma, sour, elegant, cellar smell with a hint of citrus fruits. Weak mouthfeel, the sourness is not very strong, but its too much astringent, and the bitterness is too high.

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a huge lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, wood, and brettanomyces. The flavor is sweet and acidic with notes of wood, lacto, brettanomyces, alcohol, and straw, leading to a tart finish.Earlier Rating: 8/27/2005 Total Score: 3.7An unclear light yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma contains notes of grapefruit, and metal as well as hints of hops. The flavor is rather sweet for a Cantillon, but also grapefruit sour, and with some notes of metal in the middle, before a dry acidic and hoppy end sets in.Earlier Rating: 10/24/2004 Total Score: 3.5An unclear orange beer with an orange head. Both the flavor and the aroma is a mixture of sweetness and sourness - quite a nice balance - and on top of this the most dominant note is that of grapefruit.

A splendid guese, sour nose fruit, lots of citrus. Clean flavour, no feeling of the maltEarlier Rating: 3/9/2007 Total Score: 3.9As Dermere Cuvee du 89 at the Bier Circus last week, no signs of this being retired.
Fine carbonation, firm head, with the citrus kicking in as you lift the glass. Cidery tingling feeling, the beer sparkling on your tongue like those childhood sweet-and-almost-too-sour sweets. It is lovely. But one is enough!

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of Pinball. Pours a cloudy golden with a huge and frothy white head - excellent retention, massive curtains and lacework. Fresh fruity nose with loads of barnyard. Medium body, carbonation is a bit low, first a fresh citric fruitiness then comes tons of funk and barnyard with a dry and not overly sour finish. Very pleasant and drinkable. 080411Earlier Rating: 8/21/2005 Total Score: 2.9(Bottle 75 cl) Unclear, pale golden with a surprisingly fine head - and carbonation. Very citrusy notes. Very fresh and acidic - naturally - but not over the top. 120805

Wow, I didnt realize how few ratings this one had.  Thanks for sharing, Todd!  Pours hazy golden with a massive white head.  Nose shows lots of grassy hops and sweat socks.  Big hay and barnyard aromas and flavors.  The hops make this an oddity, but a good oddity.  More, please.

Popped this open at a recent tasting to share, since its dry hopped I realized I shouldnt let it age, plus there have been a few recent beer reviews of aged Champions that were less than encouraging.

Beer is yellow with a slight haze and thin head of white small bubbles that doesnt leave any lacing on the glass. Carbonation is moderate to low.

Aroma is a little grassy with some mild hop presences and mild acetic notes. There is also some lactic in there and some nice strong funk. Smells like I expected, Cantillon gueuze plus hops. Nice.

Beer is medium to light in body. In the palate, the hops are lost among the carbonic and acetic notes with a strong lactic background and a slightly funky finish. There is no aftertaste, just another great palate cleansing sour beer. Not as complex as some of the other lambics but this beer is quite good overall. Nice drinkability.

Pours a hazy bright yellow with one finger of white head. Nose is nice and yeasty with citrus zest and white pepper. Biting tartness and nice lasting acidity with a mild bitterness and lots of barnyard notes. Earlier Rating: 1/15/2008 Total Score: 3.9Shared by turdferguson, thanks Sam! Pours a pale hazy orange with a thin fizzy white head. The aroma is tart, acidic, vinous, and a little citrusy. The flavor is tart, acidic, vinous, citrusy, very tart and acidic but still more mellow than some of their other brews. Nice tart biting  palate, not super carbonated. The finish is lasting and tart with a bit of a dry feel.

Another awesome lambic shared by Todd.  Thanks bro!   Really enjoyed this one.  I liked the way the fresher, dry hops blended with the distinct cantillon gueuze character.  It was seamless, and didnt feel forced at all.  This one might be best at its best when fresh, which I believe this bottle was.  Earlier Rating: 1/16/2008 Total Score: 4.42006 Bottle from my secret santa this year.  Thanks Jacob!  Been wanting this one for a while and couldnt wait to open it up. Shared with Ethan and Henning. Pours a hazy orange golden with a fizzy simple head that fades. Aroma is musty, lemon, basement, hay, and light grassy hops. Flavor is puckering lemon, funky cheese, and a nice citrusy dosing of aged hops. I would say this is more drinkable than the organic gueuze. Wish I had more.

Bottle at Bagers -30 party. Pours a hazy golden. Tart and bitter with some sweetness. Aromas of grapefruit. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Mellow tart finish. ThanksEarlier Rating: 5/25/2008 Total Score: 3.8Pours a murky orange with almost no head. Pretty sour and tart with some bitterness. Citric with hints of vinegar. Medium carbonation.

Bottled 375ml (bottled 290110 @Beer Hunters)
Clear copper-orange color, small steady white head. Perfumic, leathery, flowery and tart nose. Active carbonation. Tart like a typical Cantillon, but fresh hops are almost dominant in this geueze.
